Reviews.Title: “Classy serviced apartment with a fantastic view”
Reviews.Author: jeanoo
Reviews.Content: I was staying at the penthouse of Fraser Suites as part of a business trip. I was blown away by the amazing floor to ceiling view of the city in the bedroom and the living room on the 2nd floor. The apt had everything I needed - wifi, washing machine, dryer, etc... Situated conveniently, I was only mins away by cab from most of the places I needed to get to such as George Street. Pitt Street was perhaps 10 mins walk away and The Rocks was just a leisurely 15 min stroll away. The receptionists were always friendly and always ready to lend a hand. Too many lovely restaurants in the vicinity. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fraser Suites Sydney, well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Pauline P
Reviews.Content: Staying at this Hotel was just such a beautiful experience. The room we had was on a corner , we had floor to ceiling windows with a view of the whole city, night time looking out was amazing. We had buffet breakfast included and that was just lovely , a small area but big enough to enjoy. the only down side was the the holding of the $300 bond on my Debit Visa Card that I couldnt get back for up to 5 days. next time I will put that bond just on my VISA Credit Card. Other than that we had a wonderful experience at the Fraser Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with awesum city views.”
Reviews.Author: Regina N Brian M
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay with Fraser Suits after reading all the good reviews here & it was the best choice we made. It was a last minute booking but we got a great rate for one bedroom premier room with great views. We stayed here 3 nights & our room was on 37th floor room num 3706. Every thing is very modern & every thing is there what u need. The room is pretty big. The views are absolutely stunning. Few things we didnt really like The shower is great but water runs out & get messy every where. No brush or detergent in the kitchen. No tea towels. Light switches either turn on all or turn off all. Can see sum wear and tear around the room. The bed is very soft & sum times uncomfortable. Staff is very polite and friendly especially reception staff. Good location and close to every thing. Definitely staying here again our next visit to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Shoddy hotel - stayed in better Best Westerns and staff are rude”
Reviews.Author: karen1403
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 1 night break and were excited due to its reputation for being luxurious and a bit of an indulgence. We booked the holiday extravaganza package which included: Complimentary internet Welcome basket upon arrival Bottle of bubbles Complimentary fruit on arrival Breakfast Upon arrival we were sorely disappointed. Check in staff were rude and nonchalant and once up in our room we were horrified to find a mouldy bathroom, dirty carpets, chipped furniture and dirty marks up the walls. We also had none of the welcome baskets, fruit or bubbles as promised. We went down to reception to complain and were told someone would come up to our room. We called down to reception another two times before someone finally came up to the room and he agreed the room was in poor condition. We were given a box of 6 chocolates by way of an apology which we thought was pretty rubbish as we still had not received our welcome goodies. The staff were not concerned and didn't really seem to care and gave us the business card of the manager for us to email on Monday morning. I would recommend you avoid paying the extortionate prices to stay here and book into a nicer hotel where the staff actually give a monkeys about complaints. We received a full refund from the manager after showing him the photos and were promised a voucher for a free stay which never materialised (which we are secretly glad about as I would never stay here again!) By far one of the worst hotels we have stayed in made worse by he attitude of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Just love staying here:)”
Reviews.Author: Jarex26
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year for the first time and was very impressed with the Fraser Suites so the choice so stay again this year was easy. We now choose to stay here as it suits our needs such as: Location - its only a few minutes away to QVB, Exhibition Centre, City Centre, Chinatown and Darling Harbour, everything is easy to get to. Reception Staff: Top marks to the staff as check in and check out is done with proficiency. When coming in or going out the staff when possible would always look up and acknowledge you. Rooms: I love these rooms and in particular the Beds & pillows, we found them soo comfortable and our bedding requests were meet. The rooms are very clean and serviced well. Gym: I used this for the first time and again was impressed with the equipment. Our own gym in our home town isnt as good as this. The Fraser Suites may not suit everones needs but if definately met ours in every way, I highly recommend this accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Great service experience....”
Reviews.Author: wingriderAustralia
Reviews.Content: Our usual hotel was booked so we tried this as a change. The first thing was the staff were great - every contact was good and they went out of their way to be helpful. Top marks for service! The room was .... well, nice but showing signs of wear and a bit on the small side... so, compact and adequate would be a good description! The location is great and you can access the QVB via an underground quickly. The parking was easy to access and reasonable. As a suites hotel, its a nice place to stay but we decided we prefer hotels with more services and more of a 'house' atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Top Location”
Reviews.Author: Thegangs
Reviews.Content: Very modern trendy service apartment. Good size lounge and bedrooms and the bathroom was spectacular. We had a good view from the 23rd floor and we can see Darling Harbour. Very convenient for CBD shopping and the underground train is only 5-7 mins walk. Darling Harbour and Chinatown is about a 10 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not so great accomodation!”
Reviews.Author: Denroncollections
Reviews.Content: It's all very much like a modern crematoriam, dark curtains everywhere even at the spa. The rooms are good but the bathrooms are average (nowhere to hang your rinsed through smalls). The reception staff are distant and sullen and not that in the know about Sydney. They were also constantly looking down at their pc's and looked shocked each time we greeted them!! A great place though, next to everything and everywhere in Sydney but not a place we'd return to.

Reviews.Title: “Better value than most Sydney hotels”
Reviews.Author: HMCinSG
Reviews.Content: If, like me, you spend countless nights in hotel rooms you will know that getting into a room that's more like someone's appartment is much nicer. This trip I was located in a Premier Deluxe on the 36th floor with views out over the harbour to the East and Darling Harbour to the West. The room had a separate lounge/kitchenette area, with washer and dryer hidden away in a cupboard. There was a study alcove with desk and plenty of space and the main bedroom was spacious with an ample sized bathroom. What's hot? The location is great and central with access to most of the city with a 15 minute walk. There is a railway station within a 5 minutes mostly underground walk. Restaurants nearby include Chinese, Japanese, French and Spanish - pretty much anything you could want really. Coffee shops and bars are all close. Staff are generally very friendly and very helpful and it's more personal than a large hotel. The gym is very big with decent equipment and there is a GREAT lap pool and spa. The hotel and rooms are all modern and well equipped. What's not so hot? My rate included internet which worked well but was cumbersone to connect - you had to phone concierge, who had to phone you back with a code. Why not give you that on check-in? The shower was good - but in sore need of repair, with tiles coming loose on the floor. On the weekends you may have to put up with large groups and the odd noisy room - probably because the Suites are more catering to the weekday business crowd and they are much cheaper than a hotel. Generally sound this property gets a Very Good rating because it's far cheaper than a hotel and has bigger and more comfortable rooms. Nice staff and a good location especially if you are a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Not a business residence”
Reviews.Author: nhhk
Reviews.Content: On a business trip, this was not a good place to stay. Longer term stays may be reasonable. It is like a motel with maid service in office hours only, paid for Internet not working and no free alternative, no pressing service or other amenities. The bed was so soft that you effectively are on the floor. Even after a long trip from Asia it was not a restful stay.

Reviews.Title: “WOW Factor!!”
Reviews.Author: Andy H
Reviews.Content: This is a hidden gem in Sydney which I will share because I'm a nice person. The view, standard of room, pool/ gym and service were fantastic! Wish I had a place like this but will keep dreaming. Some great new restaurants and bars next door too so try it :)

Reviews.Title: “great if you don't require five star services”
Reviews.Author: kylier82
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very stylish with modern facilties. I have stayed here twice now and both times the rooms have been reasonably large, and very clean. The only negative was that I wanted to order room service at about 2pm and was told that room service wasn't available until 6pm. Thr rooms and location were brilliant, the staff and service were ok.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 5 star hotel but I want a large room at a third of the Price.”
Reviews.Author: Camerong
Reviews.Content: I always stay in a 02 or 06 rooms. Yes this is not a 5 star hotel it is a serviced apartment. So if you are after the experience of the Hilton, forget the Frasier. If you want a room that is 100sm not 32sm, then stay at the Frasier. All rooms have all you need to make breakfast and dinner, washer and dryer. Overall service is ok but I do not need to feel special, I need a large room for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, stylish hotel in the centre of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Tistybus
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay in the Fraser Suites once per week nearly every week for work (but we pay for it ourselves) and love it. I've been meaning to write a review for a while and here goes. The best thing about it is the one bedroomed apartments are very quiet - in the bedrooms you can't hear your neighbours. I'm very, very fussy with noise and love it here. The bedroom is seperate to the lounge and kitchen and has a closing door. The apartments are modern and stylish and the toiletries are great - Peter Thomas Roth hair care, body wash and lotion. I also like that a nail file, cotton wool balls and ear buds are provided along with a shower cap. It's the small things that make a stay easier. And I have lots of mini-nail files rattling in my handbag now! Beds are comfy and towels fluffy. My only sticking point is that only two towels are provided per couple and us girls use more than one towel when we wash our hair! The lighting always confuses the hell out of us - we can never work out which switch is for which light - those who have stayed there before will understand what we mean! Staff are lovely and know us by name, which you'd expect after staying there every week for over 1.5 years! Amenities are great - the pool is semi suspended over a walkway and is usually quiet. The spa is good and the gym is adequate for a hotel - 3 treadmills, 3 bikes, weights and a few other machines. The sauna is also good and there are showers for pool hygene. The location is great if you need to be near Town Hall - it's right next to St Andrew's cathedral, near Pitt St mall for shopping (3-5 minute walk), the QVB (2 min walk) and heaps of great restaurants. It's also a short stroll to Darling Harbour - maybe 5 mins and Chinatown. Restaurants we frequent are Chef's Gallery for asian food around the corner on Bathurst St, Diethenes Greek Restaurant (hillarious decore - serious stuck in the 1980s, but unreal Greek food at a great price), the tapas bar at the Sir John Young Hotel on the corner of Liverpool and George Sts and Mamak malaysian in Chinatown. However, if you really want to stay closer to the Harbour Bridge, Opera House and Circular Quay, I would stay that down that end of town. It's a good 20-30 minute walk, although free buses run down George St fairly regularly. When the Meriton on Kent St has very good deals, we have sometimes stayed there, but always wishing we were at the Fraser Suites. The Meriton is OK, but generally smells of cigarette smoke and is not as luxurious as the Fraser Suites. I don't think the staff really care about their customers either. All in all, there's a reason we keep coming back to the Fraser Suites. I'm pretty stingy with my ratings and this one deserves 5.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay with minor issues”
Reviews.Author: Jack S
Reviews.Content: Apartments are quite clean besides the light mold in wall crevices, they are well equipped, have nice interior design and modern furnishings. Beds are really comfortable and slightly on the softer side. Something that surprised me is their complimentary shampoo which contains some very high quality ingredients and are sulfate free so it's great for those of you - like me - with sensitive scalps! The mini fridge makes an occasional hum which was inaudible when I wore my ear plugs also cigerette smoke seeped in from the hallway which annoyed me to a degree. There is also a shortage of power points in the apartment, I had to unplug one of my bedside table lamps in order charge my iPhone. Finally on checkout receiption tried to charge me $60 for internet usage even though I haven't used it, after explaining this they admitted it was a system glitch and waived the charge. Other than the above minor grieviances, customer service is helpful but sometimes you can detect a hint of arrogance. The hotel is close to everything and is on a very quiet street and overall it was a very comfortable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Seriously going downhill!”
Reviews.Author: Dr-AC-one
Reviews.Content: I'll keep it short and to the point. Stayed at Fraser Suites 18 months ago while on holiday. We loved it and recommended it to several friends and colleagues. Returned in December 2011. Biggest mistake of our holiday! Rooms have deteriorated significantly. The carpets are filthy, the couches even worse and there seems to be no maintanance on any of the furniture. The baby seat provided for my daughter was filthy and was covered in food residue. The reception staff has NO clue and are not fit to work with paying customers. They overcharged my credit card by $800 and was unapologetic about it. They confused us with other customers, left a threatening letter on my car for they forgot to register my car with their parking garage. There was no laundry facility in our room, offered a free service to have our stuff laundered but ended up losing clothes and charging us for it. Unfriendly, dirty and overpriced for what you get. I am happy to pay, but don't want to be ripped off. Will never stay there again and will surely not recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Jude L
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in a two bedroom suite, which was a combination of two rooms with a third outer door. We had to ask for the door arrangements to be changed so that we did not need a key to get between the two rooms (the outer door was closed and the two inner doors chocked open). The room itself was spacious, quiet and comfortable. Room service was very limited, but adequate for nights when we were too tired to leave the building, and service was friendly and prompt. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful, and it was great that I could easily park my 4WD (there were some long parks as well), at extra cost which is standard for Sydney CBD. The building location was excellent and it was an easy walk to everywhere we wanted to go. The leisure centre was a highpoint - the windows in the bottom of the pool looking to the shopping centre below made for more interesting lap swimming, it had a large Spa and Sauna, and a spacious gym room with modern equipment. If I had to fault our stay, the walls were a little scuffed and the furniture a little chipped in places, and the iron in one of our rooms had a badly stained soleplate and I would not have been willing to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: B T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fraser Suites for 2 weeks in September, 2011 and paid extra for the suites facing Darling Harbor. Spacious suite. The location is convenient. Parking fees on top of high room charges are exorbitant. There is room for improvement in cleaning the suite.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and good location, however staff crew is minimal”
Reviews.Author: Taylor B
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel three times, for both work and leisure. The hotel is modern, has excellent views and is good value for money. Often the hotel uses Molton Brown amenities, which adds a nice touch to the large bathroom spaces. The opening windows of this high rise residential style hotel allow for fresh air, something not usually common in CBD hotels. A corner room facing the north west offers the nicest views, from the Sydney Harbour entrance, stretching almost out to the Blue Mountains. Renowned restaurant Tetsuya's is a hop, skip and jump across the road, and staying at this hotel can alleviate the need to pay for valet, or risk an even more expensive fine courtesy of finding a parking spot in close proximity if you are eating at this establishment. The fitness centre and pool facilities have been excellent on all occasions, with fresh towels in abundant supply, and the gym spotlessly clean. The only negative about this hotel would be lack of contactable staff. As this is a residential style hotel, the only real 'contactable' staff are on the front desk - there are no staff positioned at the pool, gym or at other locations within the hotel for assistance purposes. Given that the front desk is on the bottom floor, guests staying on the higher floors may find it inconvenient to talk to a real member of staff to request a service - conversely, when a request was made for housekeeping, the request was dealt with promptly and efficiently, so this should not really be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent accommodation”
Reviews.Author: jazmeenar
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed over a weekend as we had a wedding in Sydney. Superb location - everything in the city is within walking distance or a short cab ride. Loved the interior - very clean and modern. The rooms and well-fitted and very comfortable in size. Everything is very clean and feels new. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Bit on the pricey side, but I guess you are paying for quality and a very convenient location. Excellent service too.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for Darling Harbour and the City”
Reviews.Author: ClaireCtheworld
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Fraser Suites a couple of times now. It's a nice hotel with modern furnishings, very comfortable. The best part is that it's in a good location if you are heading to Darling Harbour as it's just a few minute walk away, but then it's also handy for the city if you want to hit the shops and restaurants there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and convenience”
Reviews.Author: DuffnGuff
Reviews.Content: Perfect spot if you're visiting Sydney. We were with our son and nanny and it is way way better than having 2 hotel rooms. The apartments are a good size, well kitted out and clean and well maintained, breakfast is decent as is the gym and pool. Things that are not so great are 30 odd bucks a day to use the internet which is ridiculous when you're staying for 12 days as we were. There should be some option for longer staying customers or simply they need to reduce the charges or drop them completely in line with what many international hotels, it's a 'cheap way' to make money. Also 35 bucks a day for the carpark and things start to add up. The place also badly needs an additional lift but that is probably tougher to remedy. We also all hated the beds. Overall it's a great spot to enjoy Sydney from despite the gripes.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, large rooms downtown”
Reviews.Author: LubricationWine
Reviews.Content: Great location downtown, with good service. Rooms were clean, and spacious with all the facilities and amenities you could wish for. Only gripe was that the spa in the gym, as often in hotels, was very cold. Whats the point?! Handy for China town, Geroge St, Darling Harbour, Circular key etc.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: H0ldfa5t
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms for nine days over the Xmas period for two adults and three kids. For us the location was excellent as it was central to all the sights that we wanted to see in the city and was close to town hall station. Upon arrival we were given a room that was not clean. The walls had marks on it and the kitchenette was dirty. I rang reception and asked for another room and was told that there were people that had booked for a longer period than us and we could not be moved. We have stayed in hotels in Europe and the standard and service there was far superior. Would not recommend if something else available.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jeannette S
Reviews.Content: We booked the Fraser Suites for a pre (Nov) and post (Dec) cruise accommodation. The location was excellent, the room very comfortable and clean, the staff very helpful and friendly and the view the best. Would recommend this hotel for its location because you can walk to so many interesting places (Darling Harbor, Chinese Gardens, Hyde Park, Paddy's Market, the Museum to name a few) as well as easy access to the bus service on George Street. We felt safe wherever we walked. There were lots of places to choose from to get food. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel. We wanted to experience Sydney as much as possible and went somewhere different every meal! Good memories of our time in Sydney and good feelings about our stay at the Fraser Suites. Jeannette and Allan

Reviews.Title: “o.k”
Reviews.Author: GaviaStellata
Reviews.Content: the rooms were perfect, had a wonderful view from my room, windows go all way down to the floor. the gym was excellent and the pool even more. through the bottom of the swimming pool you can see into the shopping mall. the breakfast was very unexceptional and the smell of the kitchen was nasally detectable from the lobby to the top floor (41). During check-in and check-out the staff was more or less constantly starring into the computer screen. Obviously the computer check-in/-out process requires a lot attention.

Reviews.Title: “Great view from high floor rooms”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca R
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nites for the beginning of our honeymoon. This place is so nice. The view from our suite was AMAZING !!! and we had windows that open for fresh air ;) everything you need is in the room (washing machine, dryer, stove top, dishwasher, seperate office, comfy bed, good shower, friendly staff). Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Stansted
Reviews.Content: Sydney can be expensive to stay in but we booked via Hotels.com and got a great price here for a three night stay. Large suite of bedroom, study and living space with good kitchenette and laundry facilities. On the 40th floor with great views. Walking distance of Darling Harbour with good restaurants and ferry to Central Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Great room - but why no WiFi??!!”
Reviews.Author: Melbourne_Female
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a very spacious one bedroom premier suite. The room was clean, had masses of wardrobe space (important for two girls!) and was well-cleaned each day. Biggest gripe was internet access. No wireless. Come on guys, this is 2011!!! It is essential. If you want to connect using the cable it will cost $30 per day and it was slower than dial up. Well, that was before the hotel lost all internet access for several hours. Not satisfactory. Overall score reflects internet issue. With fast wireless connection would score this much higher.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: advocate_of_truth
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because I needed a hotel to stay at for my friend's Hens Night. Upon arrival in my hotel room I noticed that we were allocated a room right next to the lifts. I was not too happy about this, because I requested a quiet room away from the lifts. But because they were full capacity, they could not move us to another room. The hotel rooms are pretty clean. The rooms are roomy. When we arrived in the room we noticed a bottle of wine and a letter. The letter or wine was not for us, it was for someone else. We notified reception and they promptly took the items away, but let us keep the wine. This was a nice gesture. The rooms were quite hot when we arrived. We turned on the air conditioning and it was still hot. It appeared that the air conditioning was not working properly. We saw a cleaner come past our room, so we asked his help with the air conditioning and he said it is definitely not working. So we decided to call reception for assistance. They said they would send someone up to have a look. Three calls later and approximately 45 minutes later the manager Ben came to have a look. We told him that the cleaner agreed that the air conditioning was not working. Ben then rudely said "No offence the cleaners do not really know much about air conditioning". We were shocked that he spoke so disrespectfully about his staff members! The manager Ben also treated us rudely too, he treated us like we were clueless. I may not be an air conditioning specialist, but I have stayed in enough hotels to know when the air conditioning is not working. Eventually the air conditioning got fixed. The air conditioning did stop working that night. A maintenance worker came to fix the air conditioning before we checked out. The beds in the hotel room were quite soft. The bathrooms were quite roomy and clean. The hair dryer is really bad! The hotel itself is located in a good position. Convenient for travellers who want to stay in the middle of everything and in close vicinity to major attractions. I would advise travellers to be aware of the heating issues with the rooms. Nothing more worse than an over heated room. I personally would suggest staying at neighbouring Apartments.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: m239a
Reviews.Content: One bad experience after another. - couldn't find booking when we checked in - took an hour to check this - never let us know - we had to chase them- seems to be common theme - rooms tired, worn, dirty, small, noisy - slowest lifts I've ever experienced in my life - three interruptions at our door within the first hour of our arriving - locked out of our room 'due to fire alarm resetting locks' - room keys needed to be reissued repeatedly (they weren't carried next to my phone as staff suggested)

Reviews.Title: “Nice looking, modern, but no good if you want to sleep”
Reviews.Author: JK_family_of_4
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over night recently for business purposes as an alternative to the hotel I normally stay at. It was recommended to my by a colleague so i was expecting quite a bit more than I got. Firstly, I was under the impression that I would be a booking an apartment style accomodation given my booking stated a 1 bedroom studio but was disappointed to find a room that was about half the size of most hotel rooms. Secondly, the bed was one of the most uncomfortable i have ever encountered (way too soft - no back support) and the pillows were ridiculously high and hard. The curtains although thick and heavy were not surrounded by pelmets so light streamed in the sides and tops. The noise level from the street was incredible, in particular considering I was on the 31st floor. All of this made for a very poor night's sleep. Thirdly, the bathroom, although clean and modern had very poor lighting. It was as if everything was on dimmer. Not conducive to shaving etc in the mirror. Lastly, although the hotel offers in room breakfast, disappointingly it is only limited to non cooked food. On the positive, the hotel is clean, modern and in a nice location. Breakfast in the restaurant was quaint although having arrived at 7:45am with only 3 other people in the restaurant I was surprised to see half of the cooked food empty. Likewise nobody explained to me that i could have things cooked to order as i then saw other people receiving. In am led to believe that the larger rooms and apartments are more comfortable and would be willing to give them another go but all in all, a disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fraser Suites 488 Kent St Sydney-Apart from lack of a view - Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: SneakyReviewer
Reviews.Content: Beautiful modern apartment in heart of city - Has a kitchenette, laundry fac, comfy bed, wonderfully clean - extra bedding had to be asked for- however house keeper was friendly helpful and caring, making sure we were ok! No points to girl on front reception - When we checked in she couldn't find our booking -took a while - When we asked for a west facing room with a view - They ignored or did not under stand our request - announced the room was north facing - Despite exhorbant price - there was only a view of aircon & tall buildings - You can also hear traffic noise from here! However it's close to Queen Vic Building 4 shopping, underground rail, monorail, coffee close by - Also Coles - Strange number of 3 satchels of coffee, sugar and small container of milk ! We ran out, had to buy coffee, tea, sugar ! Toilet inconveniently located inside bathroom! No bubbly on arrival ! 2 LCD tv's , aircon , Internet $12 a day -No problems in the stormy weather!

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodation and location”
Reviews.Author: Martynk
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in a one bedroom premier suite on the 30th floor, very nice, clean, and comfortable. Staff very friendly and location (for us) was spot on around all the major shops and darling harbour. Walked to the rocks a couple of times and took about 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “4.8 out of 5 ! Great place”
Reviews.Author: phukdesign
Reviews.Content: I loved the Fraser suites, firstly the price if booked in advance is so cheap for a property of this quality. The rooms are lovely and have a real mood about them, sexy and sophisticated and are massive (we stayed in a large one bedroom) Lovely lounge area and separate seating area, good dining space and little kitchen with everything you need. Also has a huge desk and work area where i did actually have to work during my 4 day stay. Again no free wifi ! Australia needs to sort this out... Everywhere in the UK and most places in europe has free WIFI in the rooms now, bit of a joke you have to pay for it ! I just ended up using my phone and tethering. Bedroom is massive, loads of storage another desk area and another big tv with all foxtellchannels (all foxtel sport channels 1-3) which i enjoyed as i could catch up with the EPL. The bathroom was lovely, no bath, but a big double shower and lovely big mirrors and a good washer dryer to use. Great products which were replaced daily. Also the use of a robe during your stay, which is handy for the pool. The pool and gym were great. Had a place to sit by the pool unlike the Meriton apartments down the road, also had towels to use by the pool and a good jacuzzi. The gym was huge with everything you could need, probably best hotel gym i have been in. It had a punch bag, loads of free weights, 5-6 resistance machines plus all the usual cardio stuff. This hotel is lovely and the reception team are great and very helpful ! i requested a high room before my visit and i was given the 29th floor facing out towards darling harbour (sunset every night) it was lovely. They did tell me when i asked for a high room i could pay 30 dollars for my whole stay and i would be granted one. I ignored this and chanced my luck, it paid off ! Unless if I paid the 30 bucks i would have been given floor 40 - 49 with views across the city i dont think it would have been worth it. So why have i not given it 5 stars ? Basically there are a few issues with the state of the property, they are not even massive things. In our room there were scuff marks by the door and on the wall where other people staying at the hotel have obviously dragged their bag along the wall. Also the door between the bedroom and the living room did not work properly and some of the furniture is starting to have wear marks on the corners and little chips. You can over look these things which i did after the initial 20 mins in the room. If you go to any hotel which has been around since 2007 it also is going to have a few things wrong with it. All they need to do is get the sugar soap out and tweak a few things. I would stay here again for sure and in fact i will be using the hotel again early next year as i think the size of the suites are amazing and the look and feel is exceptional. I am going to stay at the 4 seasons though for one night just to see what that is like as it is also reasonably priced. But as a conclusion stay at Fraser over Meriton or any other serviced apartments in sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: JupiterAnn53
Reviews.Content: Location is fantastic! Walk almost anywhere or the underground is a block away. Stayed for 4 days upon arrival from "the States" and stay was great. Has a washer/dryer in suite along with all the kitchen facilities of home. Large, comfortable suite at a good price. Only negative is $12.00 a day for internet access (which we decided to do without) and $ .95 per minute telephone charge (10 minute call to friends was my education). Coles and Woolworth's markets "around the corner" and lots of restaraunts/pubs nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ConradTwins
Reviews.Content: Excellent location - close to shopping areas, tourist attractions and plenty of food! Very spacious, modern contemporary design. Good value for money place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: ParaBill
Reviews.Content: A modern building with well appointed rooms. The space in a one-bed room is good, and the bed is very comfortable. Double glazing helps to keep the city noise to a minimum. The location is great - centrally located within the Sydney business district and close to Town Hall station and Darling Harbour. Staff are helpful. Overall, highly recommended. The only negative is the outrageous internet charges - $12 per hour or $30 per day. Save money and buy a coffee while you use the free wireless internet in the cafe across the road at the Medina apartments. You will also save money having breakfast at this cafe rather than spend big $ at the Fraser.

Reviews.Title: “Fraser Tweets”
Reviews.Author: Amber L
Reviews.Content: The Fraser Suites is located in the heart of Sydney city. A well appointed and well presented hotel. The staff are always professional and this hotel provides a exceptional and reliable service to its customers.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view, well sort of.”
Reviews.Author: shanport
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights, we were hoping for a room with a view and we did get one however it was facing north on the 25th floor and wasn't much more than looking at office blocks. We were hoping for a room with a view over Darming Harbour, i understand these are on the west side of the building and a little higher. Mini bar was not used as the prices were without question very high. Small packet of pringles $5. The room was very clean and well maintained. We had a suite and it consisted of a main room with kitchen laundry and lounge, then a small office space and followed through to a Bedroom and bathroom with full bath and seperate shower. The bed was soft, very soft, in fact it was too soft for us. Overall the staff were very helpfull and very friendly. We had brekfast on one morning and it was ok, but not realy worth $28 a person.

Reviews.Title: “Very stylish accommodation in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: RachelfromOz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my two small children in a two bedroom suite for three nights and we were very impressed by the facilities and the location. The rooms are beautifully furnished and maintained and it was very handy having a small kitchen in which to prepare our own meals. It is also very centrally located so is a fairly easy walk to many city restaurants, Darling Harbour and Chinatown. Also quite close to the QVB, Galleries Victoria & Pitt St Mall if you want to do some shopping. The pool is beautiful. There is also a gym although we didn't use this during our stay. We had a couple of hassles with our room and key. We checked in, were allocated a room and upon opening the door we discovered it was someone else's room! We quickly left the room and had to go back to reception to have another room allocated to us. Later that evening, after a swim in the pool, we returned to our room to find that the key pass wouldn't open the door. We needed to go back down to reception in our towels to have this fixed. It was a little embarassing standing in the lobby in our swimmers and towels but thankfully we didn't have any key issues after this and the staff were quite apologetic. It is certainly not the cheapest accommodation in town but I would have to recommend it for the location, the quality of the accommodation and the lovely night time view out over Darling Harbour and west of the city. We would happily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good experience”
Reviews.Author: Subooboo
Reviews.Content: My partner and i stayed here for our anniversary for 2 nights. I can honestly say that i dont have anything bad to say about the Fraser Suites. (apart from they dont have balconies) The room was lovely, breakfast was great, location was fantastic. The room itself was very quiet (we were on the 33rd level). The hotel was very clean. Staff (mostly the cleaners) were really friendly. Breakfast is very expensive but since we had it in included in our package it was a lot cheaper. Had it not been included i probaly wouldnt have gotten it. We didnt hear to much from the staff which was fantastic, because there is nothing worse than staying at a hotel and being interrupted by minibar or housekeeping etc... We did have the do not disturb sign, so that could have helped. Overall, if you want a Sydney getaway at an affordable price, then look no further. I will definately be coming back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Siddaryl
Reviews.Content: Fraser Suites in Sydney are sensational. We have stayed 3 times now and have compared it to other Apartments within the area - and they don't come close. Location is fabulous (close to Town Square Station to get to Airport with luggage) - staff are friendly and knowledgeable and apartments are well layed out, gorgeously presented and worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “Very good option”
Reviews.Author: The_Brown71
Reviews.Content: Good value, small kitchen which is great if you can't face another night of eating out! We had a room on a high floor which was a good thing as the lower rooms are probably noisy. Buffet breakfast is expensive and not that great so if you have the time, suggest you go to the cafe next door to the building.

Reviews.Title: “Top class all the way, best location and service in Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: From the time you check in, till you leave this place is first class service all the way. Staff are brilliant, and friendly. The rooms are the best I have seen for the price in Sydney. First class facilities, the Gym and pool are fantastic and well appointed. Its only let down by very slow internet, that is quite expensive. I will stay here anytime I am in Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: marybeatty
Reviews.Content: Where the hotel situated is great as it was a close walk to chinatown and darling harbour. Driving there yourself can be tricky as where the apartment located is on Kent Street, Sydney and it is a one way road. Arrival and getting into our room was quick. The accommodation was good for the price you pay...it's not just a hotel room. There is a fully equipped kitchen, laundry facility, separate lounge and bedroom. The bathroom was very nice. The bed was very soft but with hard pillows, you do wake up with a bit of a sore neck. Depending on which room you are allocated to - one side of the window looked into other people's apartments and the other side we got a view of the city, which was nice. There is a heated pool, sauna and gym for free use, it was clean and nice. The only thing is during check out we were charged $30 for parking our car in their hotel. This was not mentioned when we booked online or during arrival....which left a bit of bad taste. Where the apartment was located, there are so many offer of cafes, restaurants, pubs nearby for food and drinks. And the cinema was across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Who said this isnt 5 star? Fraser Suites is UNDERRATED. Will be back for sure!!!”
Reviews.Author: LorieNakasenh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the August 27th 2011 for the Mercedes Benz Fashion Festival. Now originally I booked the Radisson Plaza, but changed my mind cause I wanted something in close proximately to the main venue. Going into this I did have my concerns due to some reviews here and Radisson was rank 7th at the time and Fraser Suites 26th. But I wanted to decide myself. I booked a One bedroom suite as part of the City Lights package for $356 per night this included alot of complimentary things of course, bottle of wine, breakfast for two, a guaranteed high level room from lvl 32 and up and also some other things I cant remember. Upon arrival I could see the lobby which was very modern decked out with contemporary design. Staff was very pleasant and check in was quick and was advised my room was on the highest level which was lvl 41which I was happy cause that was my request I made to be on the highest floor. Our room was 4104. Instantly i had a feeling this was gonna be a great experience, as I entered the room I was amazed in how spacious the suite was, decor (which is really important to me) was great. You just wanna live there forever. I dont really understand the negative reviews here because if you compare this to other hotels who specializes in suites and other supposedly 5 star apartment complex FRASER is way above them all. Room was clean, we had a kitchenette area as well, bedroom was big and the views were amazing, NOW to the bed, very very comfortable, im pretty sure they use latex beds, I was scared they were going to do what Meriton does, join two singles together and use cheap beds. So I was surprise by that to. After me, my partner and friends had went to the fashion festival, enjoyed a late night feed and our frens went home. We decided we need a late check out. Even though it was 12.15am when we walked in to the hotel, we asked the friendly staff member for a late check out, and it was done with no problems. Late check out was 12pm. Check out was great, and I had advised I will be back and will request the same room cause I was so pleased with everything. The staff also reminded me that they had fax my bank for the bond to be released back in my account which was very comforting. Overall this experience was fantastic, will definitely be a regular hotel for me once Ive tried all the 5 stars in Sydney. For all of you who may be reading this and considers this place, give it a go! Hey I went in there thinking it was going to be bad because of the negative reviews here (even though there were more good reviews written) Thank you to all the staff at Fraser which made my stay there very very comforting and enjoyable. This place is classy and modern, doesnt feel cheap or tacky.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but falls short on service and appointments”
Reviews.Author: 2371mount
Reviews.Content: Terrfic location close to everything and actually quite well appointed. No slippers in the room, freezing on porcelain tiles. The dressing gowns dont fit adults or more probably have shrunk and nor been replaced Front office staff are offhand and surly, particularly if payning the bill or asking directions. Would be good value for money if not for the let down in appointments to the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “STOP LOOKING STAY HERE WON'T FIND BETTER”
Reviews.Author: leanneandrew15
Reviews.Content: We have used the Fraser Suites several times now and I don't think I would stay anywhere else. Definately 5 star . Staff can't do enough to make sure your stay in perfect. Generally pleased to make you stay a memorable one. Staff we have asked about good eateries, shopping etc have been able to guide us to great places each time. Hotel duty manager even gets in and helps out in busy times in our case assisting us to take small items up to our suite politely having an enjoyable chat on the way. Cutlery, pans, glasses and plates etc are spotlessly clean. Rooms and suites are spacious and luxurious. Beds are like sleeping on the clouds. Rooms are cleaned everyday to the strictest standards and staff make sure they leave copious amounts of toiletries, washing powder and dish washing powder. If you want more you just call down and ask. Pool and gym in the building both a size expected of hotel. You can eat there in the building or within 2 minute walk choose various types of food. There is a taxi rank right outside the door. Town Hall train station 2 mins walk away. 10 mins walk to Darling Harbour Upon booking in staff welcome you generally and efficently get you to your accommodation. When booking ask for a high floor with views of either the city or Darling Harbour both are magnificent at night. Hope your stay is a brilliant as ours have been.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Recommend this place”
Reviews.Author: kem112
Reviews.Content: Styaed in a one bedroom suie and it was fantastic. The apartment had a washer/dryer and a small kitchenette. Walking distance to Town Hall. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “High Standard Accommodation and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: franrow
Reviews.Content: Fraser Suites is a good base for business or holiday visits to Sydney. It's close to Chinatown and a short walk to Darling Harbour, Queen Victoria Mall and the CBD. Suites are of a comfortable standard and staff are excellent. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Simplicity at its best”
Reviews.Author: lynn_wabbit
Reviews.Content: We got there ahead of the check-in time, but the reception staff checked us in straightaway as the room was ready. The room we had was a studio deluxe suite which was well set out and very quiet since it was at the rear of the complex. The location was great for a city stay. It's about a 2-3 minute walk to the closest train station, and a short stroll to the shopping centre district and Chinatown - where you'll find all your shopping needs and a good range of places to dine. P.S. If you're planning to go to Tetsuya, this hotel is the best. Cos you can practically roll back to your room (it's right opposite Tetsuya) after a big sumptuous dinner at Tetsuya :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeCanberra
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this great Hotel for 3 nights in their basic level room. Everything about this hotel is fantastic. The service is exceptional. The rooms are well apointed and spotless. A well kept secret in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: FussyB00ts
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff are lovely and very helpful. Underground secure parking is limited but we always managed to find a park, plus they let us stay there after we checked out and pick it up later. We paid $30 for the night for parking. Breakfast was very nice and there was plenty of it if you were hungry. Room was lovely and clean. No view, but we didn't ask for one so not sure what's available. Quiet, except for the very occasional siren. Travelled with a toddler who slept on the sofa bed in the main living area of our 1 bed suite, which was a little inconvenient. So we put her in our room initially, and then moved her to the sofa bed when we went to bed. There wasn't really room in the main bedroom for a cot or foldout. We found the bed and pillows too soft for our liking, but we've found that in most hotels, so I suspect that's just us.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend at Fraser Suites - great catch-up with school friends”
Reviews.Author: TravelHappyOne
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel in a two-bedroom apartment with past school friends - this was a wonderful experience - I live overseas so it was nice to come home to Sydney and the hotel is the perfect place to stay when visiting.Firstly the rooms are wonderful, the large floor to ceiling windows offer a magnificent view over Darling Harbour, and it is a very close walk to Darling Harbour, Cockle Bay and King Street Wharf for restaurants bars and entertainment. The hotel is also close to the shops, Chinatown although we did not have time to visit either of these. We did, however, indulge in the pool and spa which was really very nice at the end of a busy day. Beds were extremely comfortable and the bathrooms spacious and well-appointed. I would highly recommend Fraser Suites Sydney and would definitely stay again. Service was excellent, welcome was warm and overall impression was one of great satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: emilyworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel suites with modern style. Absolutely incredible view out of the full length windows of the city. Conveniently close to lots of shopping places and restaurants. Fully equipped gym I enjoyed using. Great heated indoor swimming pool with spa and sauna. Enjoyed sightseeing around the city and shopping at Patties market as well as the shopping centre near the hotel. This hotel made a the trip a really good one and I highly recommend it if you're staying in Sydney :)

Reviews.Title: “i love Fraser Suite Sydney”
Reviews.Author: smith1277
Reviews.Content: I come to Sydney every months for business and I always stay at Fraser Suite Sydney. The hotel is nice and clean. Staffs are helpful and friendly. Personally, when reviewer said they work in a five stars hotel.They should have known that most of the hotels required an actual credit card and photo ID upon check in. I have been so many countries and i never come across any hotel not require credit card and photo ID. You are very funny written that out but it's really you own fault.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: nali1990
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Fraser Suites for one night with my partner in early July. It was a weekend away we had organised several weeks in advanced and were very excited about. Unfortunately, at check in we were greeted by the hotel duty manager, Michael. Although over the phone booking we were told we only needed to leave credit card details with reception, upon check in we were told we were not allowed to stay in the hotel unless we left a physical credit card at the counter. When we asked if we could pay by cash, Michael was incredibly rude and pretty much told us it was his way or the highway (pay upfront by cash with a $300 bond or stay at another hotel - he even preferred to find us another hotel then have us stay at his!) On top of the fact that he was constantly talking over my partner and I, he did not offer us any options or acknowledge the fact that we were given the wrong information upon booking. I ended up paying the cash up front in order to stay at the hotel. It was a terrible start to what was suppose to be a relaxing and fun weekend for my partner and I. Although the facilities at Frasers suite are fantastic, the service is absolutely disgusting and I will never return. Would not consider this a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “MICHAEL [--] IS A JOKE OF A MANAGER”
Reviews.Author: KarimMooby101
Reviews.Content: i stayed there for one night with my girlfriend and when i booked i was told that if i placed a credit card on their system i could pay cash or eftpos when checking out. the duty manager MIchael [--] was increadbly rude in the way he did not offer us any help with the problem both neither my girlfriend or i have a credit card and if we were not using one we had to pay upfront and a $300 bond which we were not told about. Michael interupted me and talked over me and did not help with the situation. I thought it was funny that i had to tell them positions i had previously held at award winning function centres just to get some respect.. Fraser Suites has fantastic facilities and i understand their policies and procedures but he was judging me and my girlfriend as neither of us have credit cards or were not wearing business suites....Michael [--] ROOKIE ERROR

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: freelunch1
Reviews.Content: Last minute booking to secure some accommodation in the city. Very easy and quick check-in after parking below the building. The room was very clean and modern, two TVs and a study-type area. Huge glass windows along one whole side of the room, great view of centre point and town hall intersection. Breakfast buffet was simple but tasty, try the muesli and yogurt!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Sydney Hotel, quiet and classy”
Reviews.Author: littlemizfab
Reviews.Content: We value our sleep quality and considering this trendy hotel is smack bang in the the middle of all the action it is very quiet. It is modern, clean and very chic. We loved the locality - not far to walk to darling harbour and close to all the shops and not too far to circular quay area. We would definately stay again. There is a gorgeous indoor pool and gym area. They have a breakfast restaurant that we did not try but looked nice - think that is the only meal served there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: IandM
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. Considering accommodation standards in Sydney, this is way nicer than a lot of other options (eg Travelodge). Location is excellent for shopping and dining at/around World Square and Chinatown, but if it's a first (and short) visit you may want something closer to the harbour (Wynyard is a good location in that case). We stayed as a party of three in a two bedroom option, which is really a one bedroom apt + a standard room. The room has everything you'd want from a hotel room, and the apartment is excellent, fitted with a full kitchen and laundry. Views are excellent from upper floors, furnishings sleek and beautiful, rooms clean and bathrooms and toiletries above average. The pool can be seen from the little shopping centre below, and both pool and spa were good (although you don't go to Sydney to bathe). We didn't try the breakfast (price seemed a bit steep), but why would you with a full kitchen and lots of nearby eateries? There's a big cinema practically next door, with a Sushi Train (=excellent sushi) inside. This place has everything you'd want for a stay in Sydney, and we can't understand all the negative reviews ... In our opinion this is the best place to stay in Sydney, and should have a MUCH higher rating. In short - we love this place, and have already booked it for two more stays this year.

Reviews.Title: “3 separate stays is now 3 too many”
Reviews.Author: Meber99
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this property. My stays range from 1 week to a few weeks. Details & recommendations: Room: try to stay in higher floors as the view makes a big difference. Expect Ikea like furniture. The beds are different quality in each room, none very good. Service: they just don't get it and honestly don't know what service is even like in other hotels/extended svcd apartments. At their prices, they should have a worthy concierge - they don't and do not trust directions or restaurant recommendations as they don't live in the city or have experience. Ask for normal service things and expect to be shocked by the staff's response. They don't know better. Location: fun, china town, tad rowdy and certainly a young person area. That said, easy access to Coles grocery store, pharmacy/chemist, movie theatre, restaurants & bars. 5 minute walk to Darling Harbour, 15-20 to Circular Quay. Easy access to light rail, bus, subway. I found it a good location. Gym: hard to beat the gym. Quite nice and a great pool and hot tub. Breakfast/food: if included, ok. If not don't as you will pay big for pretty weak buffet. Room service...not unless you have to. People/staff: they really are great. Service is a problem but they aren't rude and do want you to be happy. They just don't know good service.

Reviews.Title: “3 separate stays is now 3 too many”
Reviews.Author: Meber99
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this property. My stays range from 1 week to a few weeks. Details & recommendations: Room: try to stay in higher floors as the view makes a big difference. Expect Ikea like furniture. The beds are different quality in each room, none very good. Service: they just don't get it and honestly don't know what service is even like in other hotels/extended svcd apartments. At their prices, they should have a worthy concierge - they don't and do not trust directions or restaurant recommendations as they don't live in the city or have experience. Ask for normal service things and expect to be shocked by the staff's response. They don't know better. Location: fun, china town, tad rowdy and certainly a young person area. That said, easy access to Coles grocery store, pharmacy/chemist, movie theatre, restaurants & bars. 5 minute walk to Darling Harbour, 15-20 to Circular Quay. Easy access to light rail, bus, subway. I found it a good location. Gym: hard to beat the gym. Quite nice and a great pool and hot tub. Breakfast/food: if included, ok. If not don't as you will pay big for pretty weak buffet. Room service...not unless you have to. People/staff: they really are great. Service is a problem but they aren't rude and do want you to be happy. They just don't know good service.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a good time here.”
Reviews.Author: Dunkeld10
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Fraser Suites for 8 nights and had a lovely stay. We were in a suite on the 35th floor which gave good views of the city. When we arrived on the Saturday night, the firework display was just starting at Darling Harbour - a lovely welcome to Sydney!! The suite was good sized and modern in style and had foor to ceiling windows which gave a lovely sense of space. I agree with some of the other reviews when they say some of the kitchen essentials (tea bags/sugar, etc) were not replaced daily although this was easily solved with a call to Housekeeping. Hotel staff were pleasant with reception staff helpful. The Concierge staff were most helpful particularly Vikas who assisted in all our requests/information. We thought the hotel was in an ideal location, good for visiting Darling Harbour (5mns away) and the city centre shops closeby. The bus stop right outside the hotel. While there we visited the Chef's Gallery Restaurant, just next to the shopping centre at the hotel. What a great restaurant where you can watch the chefs make the food fresh in the kitchen in front of you!! Wish we found the restaurant earlier in our holiday!! If in Sydney again we would definitely choose to stay at the Fraser Suites. Thank - you.

Reviews.Title: “Average at Best”
Reviews.Author: danny016
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not live up to the standards of a 5 star hotel...very overpriced and the pictures are very deceiving to say the least, buffet breakfast $28pp and very limited with whats on offer...great location, stayed on level 33 and the views well there wasnt much of a view(at time of booking i requested a higher floor and only got 33)...although it was a top weekend away, just expected a little more from fraser suites, room service was quick to respond...reception was not very welcoming...the sauna was great..spa seemed as though they had put BLEACH in it..was disgusting id say its a 4 star hotel !! - furniture is modern and sleek stayed in a 1bedroom deluxe....

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: GypsyAustralia
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel very disappointing for a 5 star hotel. I did expect better. I would not stay there again and I would advise anyone not to stay there. We booked for three nights and had a deluxe studio room. It was very small. It had an electric jug and a small microwave oven. It had a queen size bed. I can hardly believe that they only leave one towel and one flannel per person (not used to that). They were mean - one cake of soap for the 3 days. Three teabags and three sachets instant coffee per day. We stay in Sydney often and have stayed at other 5 star hotels which have been excellent. We always choose a hotel that has a spa and heated swimming pool. So that was one very big disappointment for me - when we got to the pool there was a sign there for the three days stating the pool was out of order - no heating. The water was too icey cold to get in. Overall, did not enjoy the stay there at all. Housekeeping too mean.

Reviews.Title: “Just to be a bit different”
Reviews.Author: fussyadelaide
Reviews.Content: Not very impressed at all. The rooms were run down with stains everywhere and chips out of all the furniture. The view of the most expensive 1 bedroom offered scenery of the office building next door. Although the management are good to deal with and the hotel is in a handy location, i wouldn't stay there again and would suggest trip planners to be cautious when comparing photos on the site to that of reality.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Rahh92
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for one night overall happy with everything room was clean an tidy thought it would have been a bigger room due the price I payed, good service. Wasnt happy about $300 bond which I was not told about, swimming pool was cold heating was not working breakfast was nice would probably stay again

Reviews.Title: “Good value, quality city apartment in great location”
Reviews.Author: PrincessMaz
Reviews.Content: Fraser Suites was selected as an alternative to an 8 day hotel stay. The location was very convenient - 5 mins walk to the nearest train or bus, taxis at door, city centre shopping right on doorstep. The room was very modern and good quality with a good kitchen, laundry and separate bedroom. I could make my own breakfast in the room each day and do laundry. It felt more like a temporary home than a hotel room. Service was friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay here again if my trip was longer than a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant! Much nicer than your standard hotel suite”
Reviews.Author: Jonnie27
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a 2 bedroom Suite at the Fraser Suites and it has been one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. I stayed in the better of the two bedrooms which was huge with its own kitchenette and large bedroom and ensuite. The second bedroom also has its on ensuite and the living/dining area's are very plush and spacious. I stayed for a week and did not want to leave. Generally when I stay in hotels I enjoy it for a few nights, and then I miss home because I miss having space and actual living areas rather than just a bedroom. So if you are like me and enjoy a bit of space on a longer stay, but don't want to compromise on style and comfort AND don't want to break the bank... this is the place to stay! We paid about $390 a night so between the two of us, it was great given the space, luxury and location. Ask for a room on one of the higher levels if possible, the views are much better!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and views”
Reviews.Author: popeyedbug
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 days in a 1BR premier suite on the 40th floor. The views were amazing, and the suite was nicely decorated. For us the highlight was the amazing floor to ceiling windows with the great view over Pyrmont, Darling Harbour, the CBD, Centrepoint Tower and out to the harbour. The king size bed was extremely comfortable. The location is very central - walking distance from Central Station, CBD shops and restaurants, and Darling Harbour. We got a very reasonable deal on the Fraser Suites website - $245 per night (usually around $460 per night). Booking on the Fraser suites website was actaully cheaper than a few of the external sites that book cheap deals, so check with the hotel. We had kitchen and laundry facilities, including microwave and cooktop, fridge, washer, dryer. We will definitely stay in this hotel again, and would highly recommend the Premier suites.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms - Good Location - Not 5*”
Reviews.Author: CAJason80
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights back in March - we got a good deal on the rooms, so given what we paid, I was perfectly happy with the hotel. It's a nice, central location to Darling Harbour but a bit of a walk to Circular Quay (probably about 20 minutes down George St), and even further to the Rocks (around 25-30 minutes). The suites are quite nice - as luck would have it, we had a nice room up on one of the higher floors with a view over Darling Harbour (and the fireworks we saw on Saturday night). The rooms are clean, the beds are nice - but it's not eye-poppingly spectacular. Staff was warm, friendly and helpful when we asked, but it just didn't have that 'wow' factor you get at 5* hotels. Great place if you can get a deal, though!

Reviews.Title: “If you have stayed in other five star hotels around the world you will be disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: MrsDeefer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights in February. The location of the Fraser Suites is good, it's within easy walking distance to Darling Harbour, the monorail stations as well as World Square and lots of restaurants. The charge for parking and internet were over the top, $12 an hour for internet isn't funny nor is $30 a day to park. On my first night I noticed that four light bulbs in the room didnt work so I called maintenance to come and replace them. IFor a 5 star property you'd think that housekeeping would have noticed! The TV reception is also terrible. Housekeeping is also very hit and miss I had repeatedly ask for surfaces to be cleaned properly. It really started to get quite frustrating. Overall this hotel isn't that bad, but it's the small things that people notice, and it wasn't a bad stay just disapointing - another hotel with a five star rating with a three star finish. If you have stayed in other five star hotels around the world you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and central. The buffet breakfast was one of the best.”
Reviews.Author: TerriandTim
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research and found Fraser suites looked very modern and located in the main shopping and sightseeing precinct in central Syd. When we arrived we were really happy everything was as per the websites. We had. 1 bedroom suite- it had a simple kitchen and laundry spacious living area with couches and flat screen Tv. Bedroom and bathroom were also very spacious. Buffet breakfat was well worth $28. Organic juices and the streaky bacon yum. We used the gym too but found the gorgeous pool a little cold. Overall, you couldn't beat this place for it's modern, comfy feel but recommend shopping around for deals.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Indeed”
Reviews.Author: scottt80
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a couple of days and its was fantastic. The room is very clean and modern and the staff there are very helpful. Will definately visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location with a Fabulous View”
Reviews.Author: ainea
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our wedding anniversary, booking a City Lights room with a view. The view was fantastic. The service was friendly, the room was clean, and the location is close to the centre of Sydney, so within walking distance of almost everything. Also, significant plus from me that the windows open. I will definitely be coming back again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Central”
Reviews.Author: roomtogo9
Reviews.Content: Part of a chain, I think. Central to everything. Shops, buses bars and pubs. Very modern and stylish. Helpful front desk. Nice top floor pool and gym. Towels provided. Rooms nice size. Wetroom type bathroom but lighting could be better. Neat kitchenette. 2 of everything. Milk put in fridge everyday if required. Green Bus 555 free during day and takes you to Circular Quay. About 9.30-3.30 and some days to 6pm. Stop just round corner. All bus stops have timetables. About 10 min walk to Darling Harbour. Did train to Blue Mountains but check weather before you go. Much cheaper than doing a tour. About 2 hrs on train from Sydney to Katoomba. Saw Jersey Boys show. Good but tickets more expensive than London theatres. Go to the Rocks and walk round. Best time is when food market is on. Check front desk they will know. Just round corner is Chinses Restaurant Chef's Gallery. You have to queue but worth it. Went to Manley for day - good but don't go on Sunday as we did. Ferry is congested with prams etc. Don't miss tour of Opera House worth it. If seniors always ask for senior prices. Sometimes you get them and sometimes they ask for Australian Seniors Card. Sydney is a beautiful city and well worth a visit. We studied the map before booking Fraser Suites and were happy we had chosen well. This is room only but round the corner is World Square shopping centres with Coles supermarket and you can get everything there for breakfast. Also treat yourselves to a cake from 85 degrees C just other side of the Star Shopping Arcade when you turn left our of Fraser Suites. Decadent but worth it. Sydneysiders are very helpful so don't be afraid to ask for help when out and about.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible apartments with excellent gym pool n convenient location next to Chinatown harbor n shopping”
Reviews.Author: Nycazn
Reviews.Content: Everything is beyond expectation in standards The staff however is not as helpful n knowledgeable Very strange there's no housekeeping on 27th of dec

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Maria255073
Reviews.Content: Great location and friendly staff, but greatly overrated. We thought we didn't get value for money, we paid over $500 per night, yet our room did not get serviced, there were stains on the carpet and the walls, there was no bath in the bathroom! just a shower, and I have to agree with other reviews, the plumbing was horrendous. The room was way smaller than what we were made to believe by the photos, and the decor was pretty ordinary. Also, the kitchen facilites were very small, if just having a microwave and sink can be called a kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad stay, but hotel could be cleaner”
Reviews.Author: kazztazz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in December, and overall it wasn't too bad. Staff were lovely to deal with, rooms were stylish but perhaps a bit more cramped than their description lets on. The hotel is in a great location, we were able to walk everywhere easily. Our only real gripe was the cleanliness - I have higher expectations for a hotel of this calibre. Our original room had mould in the shower, and we were subsequently transferred to an alternative room due to unrelated plumbing issues. The second room had mould in the bathroom as well, so I'm assuming the level of cleanliness is the same throughout the entire hotel. The only other establishment I've stayed in with mould in the bathrooms was a backpackers hostel for $30 a night. It's certainly not one of the cleanest hotels I've encountered, and I think that issue needs to be addressed.

Reviews.Title: “positive experience”
Reviews.Author: davidcalifornia
Reviews.Content: My experience was positive. As I went over some of the other reviews it seemed like I was staying at a different place. I had no problems at all. My hope, when I check into a hotel, is that I will have a clean room and the quiet necessary to have a good sleep. Fraser suites gave me that. The staff was friendly. The location was great and Sydney is a wonderful city to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: BazzaA
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed here for 14 nights as part of our trip from the UK. I chose it as the rooms looked quite spacious on the website but it was very dissapointing. The sitting area is tiny as is the kitchen and i dont see the need for a business area between the bedroom and living area. Havent they heard of wifi? The charge for parking and internet were over the top and imho should be free .... $12 an hour isnt funny nor is $30 a day to park. We did get a reduced rate 50% off but only after complaining. The Foyer staff were very pleasant and helpful and location is fine being a short walk to Darling Harbour. Our room seemed to be unbelievably noisy in the mornings and maybe this was the plumbing as mentioned by others.

Reviews.Title: “Rip off, small rooms and Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Selina_7
Reviews.Content: As a member of the Travel Industry I recentlt stayed here rather than across the road where I usually stay when in town. I didnt book an Industry rate, paid normal rates and the room was small, cramped and very dirty. I could not get over how a hotel that ha such a lovley foyer could be so filthy! When I called down to Reception to ask if my room had been 'serviced'' or actually exit clean from the last guest, the gentleman was rude and said 'of course lady' OMG...dont ever stay here.! They didnt ven offer to send someone back up. The rates are overpriced - actually a a rip off for what you get - very small rooms, and the hotel very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Mainly Positive/Plumbing Issues”
Reviews.Author: Bootle45
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel on two different occasions before and after a trip to Noosa. The first occasion was for four nights in a studio room which we were quite pleased with no complaints we found it to be quite spacious and probably exceeded our expectations. We went to Noosa for a week and returned for the final three nights of our holiday. We stayed in a one bedroom superior room which in our opinion was wonderful. It had a living room, a fully equipped kitchen, with a larger than average fridge, a microwave, dishwasher, washing machine and tumble dryer perfect for catching up with the washing before going home. We had two TV'S a spacious bedroom and a large bathroom with a walk in shower and a bath. We had the all singing letters of welcome as returning guests, plus some fruit. I had a shower and it seemed a bit wet underfoot but I didn't take much notice. On the second day I had a shower and I thought this is very odd, the water seemed to be coming back up from the floor after further investigation I found that the tiles were loose and the water was lodging underneath the tiles. ( Read report two previous from Perth) I pressed the tiles with my hand and the water came spouting up. I rang reception and asked them to send a maintenance person so he could check it out. The receptionist pointed out that they were aware of the problem, however they could not move us as the hotel was full. Basically they had allocated us a room which they knew had existing problems and presumably hoped we would not notice or bother to complain about it. I spoke to the duty manager and asked what he could do to compensate us for the inconvenience. He could not refund us anything as we had pre paid. How about a free breakfast. Sorry sir but the hotel would have to pay for the breakfast. We were offered some fruit or a late check out, nothing else. We could be moved the following day but it was our last night so we couldn't be bothered with the hassle. The problem is that you are standing in stagnant water as the previous reviewer pointed out it is probably full of germs to say the least. Apart from this issue we really enjoyed our stay. We cannot compare this hotel on prices as we have never stayed in a hotel in Australia previously. The hotel is well located, being close to all amenities, pubs, restaurants, shops and a large Woolworth's supermarket which is very useful. Darling Harbour is very close by as is the train station. Staff are very friendly and helpful. We would probably stay in this location again and possibly this hotel if the plumbing issues were resolved. Bootle45

Reviews.Title: “Shocking Plumbing”
Reviews.Author: Rob255118
Reviews.Content: We had 4 nights at Fraser Suites. The room was ok but i noticed that since our last stay in 2008 the quality of the rooms had slipped somewhat. On our first night the toilet stopped working so requested that the next day while we were out it be fixed. The toilet was repaired to a point when we arrived back next day however the same thing happened again that night and we requested that it be fixed again. The repair was again shonky so we were unable to use the toilet. From this time until we left we used the toilet in the 12th floor gym room (from our room on 31st floor) because asking for service just didnt seem to work. This is not some cheap hotel and when paying this sort of room rate you expect at least a working toilet or someone interested enough to make sure that your plumbing works Needless to say we will never be going back

Reviews.Title: “A little Disappointing for the Price”
Reviews.Author: perthtravel_junky
Reviews.Content: Location of the Suites was good easy walking distance to Darling Harbour, and monorail stations as well as to shopping locations and restaurants. The rooms where not as large as an appartment but larger than a hotel room, and sufficinet for a long weekend stay. Two rooms, whcih are usually separate suites where combined to give a family/2 room appartment. The furnishings where modern & satisfactory, all rooms had a LCD TVs. The beds where soft and comfortable and the airconditioning worked efficently. I judge most motels on 2 things Beds and Bathrooms, the beds passed the test however the bathrooms failed. They appeared new/modern decor however there was mould all around the tiles and the around the soup/shampoo area. In the kids bathroom the floor tiles had not been sealed correctly and as you stepped on them, when you where in the shower water would squirt up like a fountain (not sure how many germs where hiding in there). The staff where very polite helpful and friendly and they where the highlight of the hotel. Although would not accomodate a late check-out they are willing to store bags for you, For the price and for what we paid do not think it is worth it. If it was cheaper then maybe.

Reviews.Title: “High quality apartments, close to attractions, friendly helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: bridlemere
Reviews.Content: Travelling to big family 80th birthday celebration with sister and parents. Had a 3 night stay booked in Sydney before moving on.
