We were so impressed with the accomodation we booked another two nights prior to flying home to UK. Clean, stylish and modern apartments with all amenities you could wish for. The reception staff were friendly and helpful. First stay was on top (41st) floor with fabulous views over Darling Harbour. Only critisism was lack of TV stations available to crash out infront of, after a long days sightseeing...and high cost of internet access - I seem to recall it was12$ for 30mins continuous use or 24$ for one day, but my memory may be playing tricks, I just remember thinking it was quick high compared to the free or low token payments other hotels had charged.

Reviews.Title: “Did not disappoint”
Reviews.Author: SereyandAlistair
Reviews.Content: We were here on the weekend for my hens night and stayed in a One Bedroom Premier suite on the 36th Floor. I had originally wanted to book the Meriton Serviced Apartments Kent St, where we'd normally get a a serviced apartment, but they were booked out so I decided to try the Fraser Suites instead. After reading some of the reviews on here and seeing the pictures, I was a bit nervous about what to expect. There was no reason for it, I was very happy with the room, the floor to ceiling windows in all rooms. It was a very spacious room with lovely amenities. The bed was very comfortable and the buffet breakfast was very good (only wish I could have eaten more but had a massive hangover). Fraser Suites has the flexibility of a serviced apartment but with the exceptional service of a hotel. All the staff were really friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “after 10 stays standard still hold high”
Reviews.Author: forward_cabin
Reviews.Content: this is now my 10th stay so i thought I'd write about it, a 5 star rating for serviced appartments in the CBD. rooms are cleaned daily and never been any issues, large flat screen TV, DVD and Ipod docking stations, most suites have washing machine dryer, dual microwave oven, dishwasher, iron, toaster etc There is a breakfast available with everything you need. One of the best equiped gyms is open 24 hr with sauna and maybe 18m pool with spa pool. After hotels in Sydney they just don't stack up to this place. For the business traveller there are business centre and meeting rooms for a charge but i've never used them. Internet charge is $25 per day but ask about extended stay and you'll get a reductions...

Reviews.Title: “Really Disappointed. So many better and less expensive choices available”
Reviews.Author: belair100
Reviews.Content: I have been fortunate to have stayed at most of the hotels in Sydney and I can say I will not return to the Fraser Suites. I was laying on the chaise watching television and a cockroach crawled on my arm. I called the manager on duty and was informed that they do not have bugs yet offered bug spray(if you do not have a bug problem why do you keep bug spray on hand). I understand that bugs do occur but the staff was not helpful during the stay. There was a large painting cloth left on the floor during my entire stay. Again not typical of a 5 start hotel. Due to the race to Bondi I had to make two reservations and actually check out on Saturday. I asked five times for the staff to notify me if a room would become available. No one followed up and I was told I had to check out. I do not have a problem with checking out but upon looking at other travel websites I found that they were offering rooms at $2000 per night. Rather than keep a customer happy they allowed me to leave and cancel the rest of my reservation. I doubt they were able to get $2000 for that one night so they lost revenue from all of the nights I canceled. I asked to speak to the manager and was told she was on leave and that another manager would get back to me on Monday. I also left a comment card and emailed reception staff directly and I have yet to hear back from anyone. At $337 per night you can certainly find nicer places that are less costly. The Four Seasons and Taj Blue are fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING SUITES!!!!”
Reviews.Author: alan0056
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Fraser Suites on Kent st in late July for a hens weekend. We had a couple of rooms booked. The first one was a 1 bedroom suite on the 40th floor and the second one was a 3 bedroom penthouse on the 41st floor. To begin with the 1 bedroom suite- wonderful! The room was very spacious it had a kitchen with a stove, microwave, mini bar a dining table for 2 and a very big lounge with a beautiful tv and dvd player all with floor to ceiling height windows with the view of Sydney (we could see town hall and st Andrews from our room) the bedroom had a king size bed- best sleep ever! The pillow and bed were extremely comfortable, and there was a second tv in the bedroom on the wall. The bathroom was also wonderful, spacious with a large shower- plenty of hot water. The only compliant would be the toilet it did not flush properly. There was a built in laundry, study desk with free wifi and a large wardrobe- perfect for a romantic weekend away. Now the penthouse..one word AMAZING! As you walk in the door you are faced with a stylish set of stairs. The first floor of the penthouse consists of 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms a kitchen and lounge room, as you walk up the stairs there is another huge lounge room and kitchen with 180 degree view of Sydney, it also faced north so we received plenty of sunlight it was an amazing room. There was also another large bedroom and bathroom with a spa bath- as well as a private study. I would recommend the penthouse for parties- or Hens nights, we had hired a beauty therapist who did massages, facials, pedi and manis for the day in the penthouse, it was absolutely wonderful. The hotel itself is nice, the staff were friendly, we did not have time to look at the indoor pool unfortunately. The breakfast at the hotel served on the mezzanine was nice, they was a choice of fruits, yougurts, cereal, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages for $28. The only bad feature we found with the hotel was that the lift was slow, it took about 5 mins to get up to the 40th floor without stopping. Overall I would definitely stay here again, you definitely get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Huge room, great location, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: SAC_London
Reviews.Content: Having spent far more time than necessary researching hotels in Sydney, I finally chose this one because it was close to where we wanted to be (Darling Harbour), was not as pricey as some of the other hotels in that area and most of the reviews were generally positive. (I don't really know what to make of hotels which have equal numbers of very positive and very negative reviews!) Check-in was very efficient but I agree with another reviewer that the credit card bond they ask for came as a bit of surprise. Still, we had booked a one- bedroom deluxe suite and it was huge. There was a very spacious lounge and the bedroom was also a good size, with another TV. There was also a small kitchenette plus a washing machine and dryer. Our room was on the 41st floor and we had a good view of the bright lights of the city through the floor to ceiling windows which went all round the living room and the bedroom. My husband and I stayed for three nights and were happy with the room and the service we received. In fact, as our room had not been cleaned the day after we arrived (we had left a do not disturb sign on the door), reception followed up with us twice to make sure it was cleaned the following day. The location is excellent: it's close to Town Hall station and the CBD. It is also only a 5-10 minute walk to Darling Harbour which is where we ended up going almost every day for breakfast/lunch as well as Chinatown where we twice had dinner. The only negative I can think of is that water kept falling in the toilet bowl for a long time (and very loudly) if we used the left button to flush the toilet instead of the right one. This was only a minor problem but it was rather surprising as the hotel itself is rather new so you would not expect the fittings to suffer from such problems. Nevertheless, we had a good experience with this hotel and would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Better service at F1 hotel”
Reviews.Author: Angelina_jNewcastle
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for a getaway. We booked a studio appt. Upon arrival, i was told there would be a $300 bond in case anything got broken etc etc. And wasnt told this when i booked. The staff were ok, but no personality and felt like they didnt want to be there at all - i know its a job and some jobs aren't the best, but at least be more attentive i reckon. Room service was ok. not a huge menu to choose from, but if you want dinner, theres a pub on the corner (im not sure of the name of it though). Its got good food etc etc. I wont stay here again, but The location is pretty good. so if you want that, stay here. I stayed at F1 the next night at sydney airport, and the reception was 100% better. BUT P.S the bed is realllly comfy!

Reviews.Title: “room with a view”
Reviews.Author: kaz188
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here overnight with some colleagues, a few from interstate. Really glad we got to stay at this hotel. Service at the front desk was speedy and friendly both at check-in and check-out. The studio room was more than adequate for 1 person, equipped with a king sized bed, a desk, an armchair and even a kitchenette. Loved the toiletries so I took them home. Fresh, modern decor with fantastic views of Sydney from the floor to ceiling window. Also because the rooms were so high up (I was on the 31st floor), there was no traffic noise to be heard. Would definitely stay here again! One negative point - I found a shower cap hanging from a hook on the bathroom door, most likely from the previous guest.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Central Location”
Reviews.Author: callinghomekids
Reviews.Content: Got a great half price deal on this hotel on Expedia-which made it even more worthwhile! Decor is fairly minimalist and modern-might not be to everyone's taste, but it is all fairly new and clean. Very comfy bed, good room amenities-only complaint about room was nowhere to store larger suitcases. We had studio room so had a kitchenette (not full kitchen)-so we didn't use breakfast room, but had this meal in our room.Soom car noise from street below at night-but didn't bother us too much.If you are a light sleeper wouldn't be the best-but you are in the middle of a big city! Outstanding leisure facilities-lap pool, sauna, spa and extremely well-equipped gym. Amazing location for being central-3 minute walk from Town Hall train station. Staff very courteous-gave us access to gym and pool on last day when we had a late flight out.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay overall”
Reviews.Author: elbert123
Reviews.Content: Central location, huge room with great inroom facilities with kitchen, washer and dryer are great pluses (we had the 1-room studio). Service is friendly but as many visitors have pointed out here before, staff lack training on local info. such as public transport and attraction. Do appreciate their effort to accomodate us early in the morning (7:30am) as our flight arrived Sydney at 6am! Will recommend this hotel to other visitors. Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Groeneveld
Reviews.Content: I travel a bit with work and this hotel is as good as any I've stayed in (anywhere). It's essentially an apartment hotel but with most of the bells 'n' whistles you find at a normal 4-5 star hotel. Location The Frasier Suites is centrally located at 488 Kent St. It’s within walking to just about everything. I had business to conduct at Circular Quay and found the 20min walk most enjoyable The Staff After parking my car in the basement car park (for free) I proceeded to the lobby area to check-in. Check-in itself takes place with both staff and guest seated which is not something I’m used to, but a nice change all the same. I received a very friendly welcome from the staff who were extremely courteous and eager to assist, explaining all the hotel’s amenities and services. The Room I was lucky enough to be handed the keys to a 1BRM apartment on the 41st floor which had sweeping views out to Darling Harbour and well beyond. The room itself was one of the best I’ve stayed in, beautifully appointed with modern furnishings and extremely clean in every respect, the bathroom is especially memorable. Being an apartment it had a separate living area and while not huge would be more than ample for a couple visiting for a few days. What also surprised me was that parking was included in my tariff which would normally cost you in the vicinity of $35 p/day. The Food I didn’t actually eat at the hotel but it had an extensive (moving menus) room service menu on offer as well as an eat-in breakfast if req’d. As I’ve never been one for eating a hotel breakfast I quickly found a small café located just a few doors away called ‘Bar Adyar’. It’s one of those cosy laneway Cafés more commonly found in Melbourne. They have a simple blackboard menu, I opted for the 2 soft boiled eggs with sour dough ‘toast soldiers’ which was delightful, all for just $7.50. The coffee there is also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with wonderful view.”
Reviews.Author: annalom
Reviews.Content: Booked through wotif.com mystery deal. Excellent location, close to shops, & sights. Walked to Circular Quay,Oxford Street, Surry Hills. Opposite Chines Gardens & close to Darling Harbour. Stayed on the 40th floor, magnificent views. Clean boutique type suite. Beautiful swimming pool. Great gym.Certainly will come again.

Reviews.Title: “One Night - No Issues”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaFamilyMan
Reviews.Content: Spent one night mid-week for business with wife. Booked via WOTIF as “mystery studio 4.5 star in CBD” for $175. Never heard of Hotel until booked. Checked review once told and mostly good. We arrived at 5pm (had told then 6pm) our room on level 16 was clean, and ready. We found Hotel is very new, maybe 12 months old and contemporary design. No faux gilded luxury, but clean, crisp modern finishes. Staff very helpful (despite WOTIF purchase and I mention this as previous mystery WOTIF booking at another CBD Hotel made us feel like interlopers when we asked for any upgrades). Here staff apologized being full due to Rugby State of Origin on that night but freely offered complimentary late checkout of 12pm. We declined having early business to attend so they countered with free bag pick up and storage from our rooms the next morning. Not bad. Lift very, very fast. Again contemporary styled long room with full length and width view over offices to Darling Harbor (but not for long as new building being built). Rooms are called studio which to me only diff is sink in kitchenette, which is appreciated when making morning cup of tea as somehow filling the kettle from the hand basin next to Toilet does not feel the same. Good work Desk with work chair. Also Comfy designer copy swivel chair and foot stool. Smaller than usual huge LCD TV but that mean it does not dominate room and we go to a Hotel to watch TV? Free pay TV. King size bed! YES Large, modern bathroom with surprisingly, a huge amount of storage. Good towels with lots hot water supply via dual shower of showerhead or hand held hose. Shower only in ours. Note: bathroom AND shower is heavily mirrored so that can be err, romantic bonus or a bit confronting for some?! Location: central as Hotel next to Church next to Sydney Town Hall /Council/Town Hall Station so for those who don’t know, the geographical centre of Sydney CBD. Easy to walk around. We changed in comfortable clothes and walked the 10 min to Cockle Bay/ Darling Harbour. We returned after Lindt Café Hot Chocolates ($7 each but special) and I showered whilst wife watched the pay TV. Back down the fast lift and out to George Street (50 m) we hoped a bus to the Rocks to “Baroque” restaurant (awesome and affordable French bistro). Say 10 minutes at 7pm on bus. Returned around 9:30pm and enjoyed a great night sleep in again, Kings Size Bed. We woke early and showered no issues with hot water and left at 8:30am to breakfast at “Le Grande” Café. Again, very good French food for $20 all up. So we cannot confirm or deny other reviews that breakfast is overpriced and average but experience has taught us ALL Hotel breakfasts (unless the restaurant in the Hotel is itself of note, like Liliansfells “Darley Restaurant “or Radisson “Celsius”) are overpriced. I.E. Soffitel Wentworth charged $38 a head for typical buffet. Note to Soffitel: nothing out of warmer tray is worth $38 each. Staff wished us well onleaving and confirmed bags storage and on our return at 2pm luggage was stored and ready to go, they called Taxi and we left to smiles. All in all, simple, elegant, not pretentious, no price tricks and a good night sleep. I would suspect parking would be expensive being central CBD. Did not get to use pool or gym. For a large Hotel in CBD (40 floors) it felt boutique and welcoming. Would go again any time.

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay here if I went back to Sydney again”
Reviews.Author: widespreadvisitor
Reviews.Content: My wife, my two kids and I were on holiday in Sydney in June 2009, and picked this hotel at an airline website. The location being very central drew me to choose this hotel. Upon arrival at the hotel from the airport, the front counter staff was very quick to allow us to check-in and we were upgraded (with a fee) to a larger family suite. The room was nice, with a good kitchenette and laundry facilities. I thought to myself that I had made a wise decision in choosing this hotel. All went well till the same afternoon when we heard a fire alarm followed by an announcement that it is actually a fire drill. This happened when we were all resting after the flight. A little bit irritated, we just continued sleeping. The front counter staff was all very kind and polite, but they knew nothing about the surrounding shops and eateries. Whenever we asked them about where to get thai food, or indian food, or any food for that matter, we always got back a blank look followed by vague directions. Most of the time, we just walked about and found shops, which are abundant nearby. The location is really good as many shops and shopping complexes are near, but the staff does not have a clue on where the shops are. Mind you, we were not asking for the "best restaurant", we are just asking for "a restaurant". On the second night, at about 1.00 am in the morning, there was again another fire alarm! I was wondering what the heck is going on! Since we were at a higher floor, I thought I'd better check just in case there is really a fire. When I opened my room door, there was water flowing from the smoke detector on the ceiling! I peeked out and found two people running down the stairs saying fire! I immediately got my family, put on the shoes, got our passports and wallet, and went out of the room. As we stepped out, a front desk staff appeared, and told us to be calm, and that it was a false alarm. He said he doesn't know why the alarm was triggered, but told us to go back into the room. Unfortunately, the water flowed into our room and flooded the front entrance and carpet. I was then adviced to go to the lobby, using the lift and wait there. A little while later, the same staff came down and said he has sorted out the flooding. I went to check and found that they took OUR towels and used them as floor mats to absorb the water! Furious, I told them to sort out the cleaning, close my door, and give me another room. They obliged and gave me a room with a queen size bed for the four of us. Really, it was uncomfortable. Just before going to bed after the dramatic night, I just thought I'd go check if the room was closed and locked by them. Thank god I checked, as the room was just left bare open with all our belongings in it. The next morning, we woke up early and went back to our room, as we had to catch a bus to the Blue Mountains, . We took all the towels from the temporary room to our actual room, got dressed and then left for the Blue Mountains. When we came back, we saw the room cleaned in a shoddy manner, and the carpets still damp. Oh, what the heck, just forget about it and we went on with our activities. Of course, lots of apologies from the front counter staff, but that's all we got. The cleaning service was really bad! On the last day, we decided to go to the Sydney aquarium. It is in Darling Harbour. At Darling Harbour, there were many nice simple food outlets, any type you want! I was just thinking, why didn't they just direct us to Darling Harbour, which is about 10 minutes walking, to get food? Why were the front counter staff soooooo......blurrrrrrrr when we asked them about the eating places around? In conclusion, Sydney is a nice place to visit. However, I would not stay at Fraser Suites in Sydney again. The front counter staff are poorly trained and do not have a clue on how to give answers to simple questions. There is really no point getting a hotel centrally when the staff there does not know how to get access to food shops etc.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with stay at Fraser”
Reviews.Author: JesskaTwo
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent 1 night at Fraser Suites. Found the room to be comfortable, bed was great, two TVs are always a bonus! Small kitchenette although we didn't use it. Bathroom was quite large although everything was kinda cramped along side the wall. The 1 bedrooms have a great bed. Best sleep I had had in a long time. Very well located. Confusing parking structure at times. I really like the layout of the lobby, three check in desks so you sit down while you check in. Had no isses with the property, would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Luxury in prime location”
Reviews.Author: STomSF
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after a disappointing trip to Cairns, so instead of sticking it out we returned to Sydney early. Booked Fraser Suites as we wanted a nice hotel with a separate living room/bedroom and like modern/contemporary decor. Location is fantastic on Kent Street -- steps from Darling Harbor, a few blocks from prime shopping, and very close to great restaurants. Check in was mostly painless, though one clerk assisting us was probably very new as he was pretty confused by our booking. But nice touch to have a seating area to work with the check-in staff. Went up to our room on the 24th floor (actually the 14th floor, as floors go from lobby to 10 immediately) and was extremely pleased to see the room layout. Roomy, spacious, fantastic view, full kitchenette, full laundry, great bed, floor to ceiling windows.... Everything we were hoping for. Location has been great -- though we had some light rain the first few days we just adjusted our leisure plans for shopping and gambling. Shopping on Pitt/King streets was not a far walk, and shops were great! Star City Casino is walkable and we came back with more money than we left with, so that was a great plus. Restaurants in the Darling Harbor/Chinatown area were great too -- breakfast buffet in-house was the one down spot, cold and overpriced with not the greatest selections and flavors. But still loved our experience at the Fraser Suites, would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Hopes dashed - disappointed with accommodation.”
Reviews.Author: UkGeordietraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel/apartment for 1 week in November. After reading the reviews we were both looking forward to both our stay at the Fraser Suites and our first visist to Sydney. Whilst the accommodation was very modern and attractive, it was a little too minimalist for out taste. I was also disappointed with the lack of laundry facilities in the studio apartments and after travelling for 3 weeks could have used a washing machine, rather than pay a fortune for laundry bills. At least a communal laundry could be provided for those using studios. We were also disturbed until the early hours of the morning ie. 3 -4 am by a party of girls in the room next door. Reception staff were not particularly helpful and were most unhelpful when we queried our account, actually charged nearly £200 more than we were quoted when we booked. No reason given, no refund either. We will be going back to Sydney but will not stay at the Fraser Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch City Center Hotel/Suites”
Reviews.Author: IanHay
Reviews.Content: Expensive, but upmarket and at centre of town Rooms are large, bedroom aslso decent size, and so two effective rooms. Kitchenette is modern and there is washer dryer in room as well as dishwaser etc. A proper apartment, very nice, very clean and very modern. Ideally place for Chinatown, Darling Harbour and the main CBD. If you want town centre and decent apartment - this is ideal

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Functional but some problems”
Reviews.Author: carrom
Reviews.Content: Once you got beyond the freezing lobby, our one bedroom suite was comfortable and well appointed with decent city views though no balcony. However 1) the pool is really not as nice as it looks: dark and narrow and gloomy - could be anywhere in the world. 2) the business centre and internet were not working for our whole 6 nights stay. this was really annoying as had to go to a grotty basement in a McDonalds every day. 3) the kitchenette was not well stocked with pots and pans. Overall I was not very satisfied and preferred the Meriton in Pitt st where I stayed last time which was cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Mianel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in early February 2010. I was a bit reluctant to book here as the reviews on Tripadvisor were quite contradictory. However, this is really a wonderful apartment hotel. It is very centrally located, only a 7 minutes’ walk from Darling Harbour and the convention centre. The rooms are beautifully designed in a modern style. We had a one-bedroom premier corner apartment on the 31st floor. The apartment has everything, even a dishwasher, microwave, washing machine, dryer. At first notice you don’t see that them as it is all hidden behind doors, which gives the apartment a stylish and really comfortable look. Not to forget the big desk with internet connection (has to be paid extra at AUS $ 25.00 per 24 hours) which is built in between two separating walls, which is fantastic if you want to work without disturbing the sleep of your partner. I always try to find an apartment when I have to stay longer than a couple of days. And this was the best I have ever had. I can definitively recommend to stay at Fraser Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Glass bottom pool!”
Reviews.Author: hateswork
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 nights in a one bedroom apartment. I agree with all the previous favourable reviews. Staff were were very helpful, the room was large with plenty of room for our little one to run around. The rooms were well appointed with 2 flat screen TV's, kitchenette, and a king sized bed. The was no extra charge for a use of a cot which we have found to be quite rare with Australian hotels. We used the recommended baby sitting service which was fine though a little expensive. There is a large indoor pool with 3 glass windows in the bottom of the pool so you can see down into the shopping centre below. There was also a spa, large gym and a sauna. As previously mentioned the location is great with an easy walk to Chinatown, Darling Harbour , Paddy's market, the monorail and the convention centre. It is a bit of a hike to the harbour bridge and the opera house about $10 in a taxi though you could walk it. The hotel breakfast was a little expensive though there are convienence stores and cafes near by. My only minor complain is the lifts are a bit slow and temperamental.

Reviews.Title: “Very suprised!”
Reviews.Author: LucasK
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Deluxe 1 Bedroom Apartment on Level 29. Wow, very suprised. Quite big, plenty of space, very modern and yet also very comfortable and cosy. Everything in the apartment was top notch, no complaints. View over Darling Harbour. Only 3 lifts but really this is not something to complain about. Service was great, aside from a rude French man at reception who showed no respect to myself and my mate, maybe our age? Everyone else was excellent. Housekeeping didn't arrive until called, but this would have to be the only gripe. Pool and gym were excellent and it was great to find a gym stocked as well as a paid for gym. Great value for money and will definately be back. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “This place should be at least in the top 10 in Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: Max S
Reviews.Content: Clean, Modern, Fantastic place, no idea why this is not higher rated on tripadvisor. Had a one bedroom suite on expedia for about 150 a night and wow what. a deal for Sydney. Swam every day in their lovely and practical swimming pool. Used their in suite cloths washer/drying machines. Used there super high speed internet. There staff was great, especially Zoltan who bent over backwards to be helpful! Cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not great”
Reviews.Author: TucsonTim
Reviews.Content: Couldn't get back into the Quay Grand Suites for New Years Eve so we booked the Fraser Suites. We had two "adjoining" rooms. Well they don't actually adjoin, they share a common entry with separate doors into separate suites. Not a big deal but when traveling with a special needs child it was a little disconcerting. The larger suite had a funny odor from a bathroom flood onto the carpet. For a high end hotel, I think that was unacceptable. Thought we were going to be moved due to the scheduling and the high occupancy, but we weren't. The rooms are large enough and very comfortable. There was a strange sliding glass enclosure in the larger suite. When slid accross the width of the suite it made an enclosure, kind of like a balcony about 4 feet deep. You could literally lock someone in the space. I really couldn't figure it out. My autistic son loved sliding the glass doors back and forth and his older brother only locked him in the space once. Location is great for Darling Harbour and the Town Hall area. There aren't many rooms on each floor, but there are only 3 elevators for 36 floors. there was only one computer in the business center. Breakfast was nice but not nearly worth $22. Much better coffee and breakfast across the street for much less. The staff was friendly and helpful. I gave the Fraser Suites 4 stars because I couldn't give it 3 1/2. I wouldn't recommend the hotel because for the price I think you might do better and for only a little more you can stay at the Quay Grand Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location in City-Good facilities”
Reviews.Author: em_be53
Reviews.Content: We actually won a night here as part of a Radio station prize, so cannot comment on the cost of the room. The location is pretty central, it's a bit towwards the grungier end of the city but close walk to Chinatown, the Big Cinema Multiplex on Georgee St, Darling harbourm the QVB, etc. Parking was expensive, but you can get cheap weekend rates or earlybird in the carpark opposite. Facilities are great. One of the best hotel Gyms I've come across., 25m lappool above some sort of shopping mall with windows in bottom of pool, spa, etc. We had breakfast in the restaurant. Expensive, but no more so than any City hotel. Actually my recommendation would be to spend the extra $10/head over breakfast here and go to the Hilton for their hot breakfast, only 2 or so blocks away. Rooms clean and functional, with little kitchenette if you were staying for a while aand living there. eating in. Staff seemd fairly friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “go there if you really want to feel delighted going back home!”
Reviews.Author: go2vavau
Reviews.Content: well... Fraser Suites, we stayed there a few times already, because we believe that there has to be something good in everyone. But now we won't go there again as location and design isn't everything in hospitality. -go there if you want to stay in a shoebox (even if it has a nice view) -if you pay for a late check out and want to be called twice and additionally have people knocking at your door several times, starting immediately after 11 am. - if its your birthday and your partner want's to treat you with a stay in a nice Hotel...yes, you might even get a birthday card from Fraser Suites, just don't worry if there is a wrong name written in it -at least they tried... -arrive at reception to check-in (after 3pm) should be fine, BUT if you're partner has booked the Hotel and even if your partner has informed the staff about your check-in and has already given them your full name over the phone and in written form by email! (just to make sure!) be prepared that they might ask you to wait till your partner arrives too to check in together (hard if your partner attends a conference with an open end discussion as the last point of the program) or change the booking to your name and credit card (even if it was prepaid!). If it's a business trip for your Partner, this would be really helpful! After showing them the print from the original booking again (the name of the person ching in written on it), they might let you check in -after photocopying your photo ID. -You finally get to your room, just close the door have a look out the window to admire the view, there might be a knock on the door with a guy shouting 'minibar'! opening the door before you get the chance to get there... tells you he has to check the minibar if the previous guest has taken something out -remember arriving at check-in counter quarter past 3pm (check-in is from3pm, that's what's written in their bochure...) and after the discussions there it was well after 3pm so there should have been enough time to check the minibar right? The guy might looked at you and ask if you've just checked in??? If you say yes he might open the minibar and start talking to himself :don't know, something's wrong here, can't quite figure it out... checking for another few minutes remember the room in this case has the size of a shoebox so you might imagine the size of the fridge.... then he might come a bit closer to you (still admiring the view out the window) while having a look around the room, giving you the kind of look, like I know you're probably a bad person. Telling you he has to bring a new bottle of water, as there is one missing! You might have an almost full bottle of powerade (know it's bad stuff) in your hand so you obviously didn't take the water out the minibar, just seconds after finally getting into the room.... -when your partner will check in later after, tired after a long conference - they'll do the Photo ID copying thing again, even if they have yours already and even if you're returning 'guest'. -as you might have stayed there before you'll know you can leave the showergel at home as they tend to have a good one...but there could be nothing in the room, so you have to ask for it, the next day as there might have been a bit left in the tiny plastic bottle you didn't throw it away...as you still try to be at least a tiny bit ecofriendly. so of course you won't get a new one again... you check out (in this case) on the first of november 09 and already have the feeling it's enough now -we won't do it again! You might receive a letter from Fraser Suites two days later, telling you that they will charge 3$ from our Credit card for the water from the minibar.... Well how good is that! The guy really knew that you're such a bad person!! It's not about 3$ it's about treating guest should write customer as guest isn't quite right at this place. So in the summary we can't recommend it any more as there had been too many of this 'small incidents' that just accumulate to the stage of 'unbearable' treatment of customers. Fraser Suites is not a cheap place at all and maybe they got to busy too fast. So if you go there don't feel too disappointed if they don't treat you as they should. They do have nice big suites too indeed, but this kind of 'incidents' happened in this rooms too. We travel to Sydney frequently, stayed at many Hotels and enyoyed the Fraser Suites in the beginning, when they were just new. Some Hotels are really pleasant and so far our best experience was with the Amora on Jamison (more than once, very helpful without charging your credit card first ).

Reviews.Title: “Better than the usual small hotel rooms”
Reviews.Author: cea2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights for an interstate wedding. I booked a prem 1 bedroom suite. Although the rates were a little on the pricey side, the room itself was great. It had a lounge suite in front of the LCD TV, a fully equiped kitchen, large desk and study area,seperate bedroom and a small but modern bathroom. It was worth paying a little more not be stuck in the usual tiny hotel room box. The hotel itself was in a great location, very close to a train station, 3mins to George St (one of the main streets in Sydney) and a easy walk (say about 10 mins) to Darling harbour. On the down side I asked for our checkout to be pushed back 1 hour due to a change in flights. The staff said that would be fine but only for a FEE! I thought this was pretty poor service. Also, the reason we were in Sydney was to attend a friends wedding. I asked the front desk if they could book a taxi to collect us for the wedding at a particular time. They stated there was no need to book a taxi and that we cold just hail one front out on the street when we were ready! Again, pretty poor service. Overall, rooms were spacious, clean and modern. Great location. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel - suited for business”
Reviews.Author: dougieCavan
Reviews.Content: stayed here as pasrt of trip to newzealand and oz, this hotel was fine, the room was great and roomy, has a great swimming pool, its decor is grey in colour and really gave the hotel a business feel to it, preety close to main attractions of sydney - probably not a suitable family hotel

Reviews.Title: “NOT WORTH IT”
Reviews.Author: wantbetterservice
Reviews.Content: Just not worth it another hotel with a five star rating with a three star finish. Find somewhere else.... If you have stayed in other five star hotels around the world you will be disappointed. The rooms are clean and tidy and the suite is spacious and thats were it ends. The room service finishes at 10:00pm with only about 6 items on the menu. We were treated like it was a privilege to be staying with them and they tried to get more money out of us for a late check out on a sunday. Not even the FS that we stay in are that way inclined; if available they will offer it. I would expect a bath or spa for $660 a night and maybe some soap in the shower. The two hand size towels they offer are appalling and they had not even replaced the toilet roll (1/4 left). I know this seems petty but for $660 a night I expect a lot more. They do not deserve the rating as so many other hotels don't either. Come on lets lift the game in hotel standards in Australia its not good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Best serviced apartments - 5 star accomodation, every required facility and well designed”
Reviews.Author: AFSingh
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at Fraser Suites in August with my mother and 9 month old baby in a premier one bedroom suite. I booked on Expedia and had a great rate and after spending the time there, a great deal I feel. Check in was quick and friendly, I was concerned having made the booking online.... The suite exceeded my expectations, and everything was spotless and 5 star hotel quality,well designed with great details and level of finish. I made use of the parking facility. Location was so convenient and central. Very comfortable bed. Great bathroom with separate shower. Honestly, all facilities I was looking for and more. With the baby it was great. They lent us a travel cot for the duration of the stay FOC and in the evenings (when we stayed in) I could put him to sleep, slide the door closed and we could have the living room with TV and kitchen/ laundry to ourselves and entertain friends without feeling confined and in a mess. One night I stayed in and ordered dinner from one of the restaurants in the city and had it delivered to my door from the vast selection of menus from different restaurants found in the hotel compendium. Didn't expect much, but ended up having an excellent Japanese meal! My only complaints would be the following: one night one of the apartments had their door opened and were cooking and the smells travelled under the door and filled out the apartment. However, I complained to the reception and they promptly informed the guests and sprayed out the smells in the corridor. Took a little longer for the apartment but I appreciated the response. AND the bell captain was a little slow on bring up the bags and down....I felt that service didn't match the responses received from all other departments. I was so impressed, I didn't know there were serviced apartments of this quality, so would recommend it above and beyond!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accommodation and all staff at all levels really friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Akuakku
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 14 nights and have just come home today, August 30. The accommodation was all that I had hoped for. There were plenty of staff on the front desk and they all had cheerful smiles and said nice things. Even the cleaners were wonderful. It was perfect for us, no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 'home away from home'”
Reviews.Author: gavinmcconnon
Reviews.Content: I have been living at Fraser Suites for most of 2009, and cannot recommend it more. This is a ideal hotel for long stay travellers. I always stay in a 'premier' north facing room. This is a large room with a great view. You have all the amenities of home (cooking, washer/dryer, separate living / dining room). The hotel is very modern and new. Finishing are of a very high standard. The pool / gym is excellent and staff are always very friendly and helpful. This is not a 5 star 'full service' hotel, so don't expect excellent dining options on-site. However, the rooms and accommodation are as good if not better than most 5 star hotels I have stayed at, and all other options you would expect from a 5 star hotel are there (laundry, etc) Location is excellent, right in the CBD, close to all amenities. Every time I come back to Sydney, I will continue to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Value ONLY when on special. Not as great as they make out”
Reviews.Author: ddr_2009
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel via one of the last minute accommodation sites as a secret hotel. Firstly they told me the wrong check in time on the phone and insisted (rudely) that I'd made the mistake when we arrived. Then they sent us away for over an hour as they weren't ready. Secondly I had a special request which involved preparation by them - they stuffed this up. Thirdly the room was very nice and modern and new-looking but had some strange touches like cords dangling from the wall-mounted LCD tv and a rusty electric kettle. All our stay was OK given the special price that we'd paid but the service was poor and they room was modern and nice but not amazing. Definitely not worth the huge rack rates - if I'd paid anywhere near that I would have been really annoyed!!

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: Ianatios
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. It was funky.. Edgy and Modern. I loved cheaking into this hotel.. where you get to sit down and cheak in.. be on the same eye level with the admin staff. We stayed in a studio room.. It was large and fantastic with an awsome marble bathroom and the Molton Brown toiletries were grand! My only bad point was the holding deposit was $300 for the overnight stay and it was mistakenly held for 2 weeks!! LOL but other than that.. i could not fault it. Nice and quiet with an awsome view! need i say more!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: SydneySuperb
Reviews.Content: would highly recommend this hotel, was very impressed.we were upgraded to a 1 bedroom deluxe suite, very roomy, value for money was great, in a superb location, staff very friendly.will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay at the Fraser Suites....”
Reviews.Author: aussienard
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fraser Suites in a 1 bedroom, premier suite for 5 nights in March. The Hotel was very nice, however seemed a little lacking in personality (which is sometimes the case with bigger hotels). Our room was very comfortable and was certainly spacious. There was a clearly defined lounge/dining area (with a washing machine and dryer in a little cupboard off to one side), this area also housed a small kitchen space (not that this was used for the duration of our stay). The bedroom was nice and as we were on the 47th floor we had some nice views of the city and a tiny glimpse of the Harbour Bridge - the room and hotel however, was not chosen for views. The bed was really comfortable - king sized, with nice crisp linen. The bathroom was off the bedroom area and had a good sized tub and a great shower with terrific water pressure. The room was decorated in shades of grey and was quite modern. I could find no fault with the furnishings (taking into account the general wear expected in a well used apartment). Location wise the Fraser Suites were wonderful - very close to everything and close to transports routes to boot. The lobby was quite nice - as were the general use facilities such as the gym, swimming pool, sauna etc. These were well frequented by many guests during our stay. We had one small issue (which I was not sure about mentioning), but have obviously decided to! The first night of our stay we returned to our room after a lovely dinner - bathed, etc and went to slip into the robes supplied, only to find one had what was very obviously faeces on it!!! This was around 11:30pm - so we called down to the front desk to have someone come and collect it - no-one wants someone elses poo in their room after all! This information was met with a giggle... We could see some humour in this situation but would have appreciated a little more professionalism. A young man came and collected the offending robe and took it away - but did not supply a replacement. The next morning on the way out to breakfast - my husband asked at this reception counter if someone would replace the soiled robe. Reception knew nothing of this - no information had been supplied to day staff about this incident. The lovely lady on reception at this time was quite horrified and extremely apologetic. When we returned to our room a fresh robe had been supplied and a message had been received to contact the duty manager regarding the matter. We rang the manager who apologised and sent a bottle of wine to our room.... That was that and nothing was mentioned again reagrding this matter. In all fairness, whoever had soiled the robe had gone to great pains to hang it again exactly as it had been and I'm assuming housekeeping staff therefore did not notice the offending marks...... Perhaps something they could have housekeeping check in future???? Other than this - there were no issues with our stay and the hotel was modern, pleasant and had all the facilities you would expect. I would probably stay here again - but would recommend a check of the bathrobes before popping one on!

Reviews.Title: “no complaints but not fantastic either”
Reviews.Author: familymanHongKong
Reviews.Content: The location is very close to the subway station but of course as a tourist if you could stay next to circular quay I would recommend it to avoid the multiple trips to this central departure point to most tourist spots. The immediate area is also a little run down & not the best for shopping unless you are looking for a few bars & adult magazine stores.The staff were all very friendly & helpful from the front desk to the cleaners, the pool is a good size although they ran out of towels on multiple accassions. We stayed in a 2 bedroom, were they connect a studio to a one bedroom. Both rooms were clean but I would say the studio was no larger than an average hotel room & the only difference from a 3/4 star hotel room was that they included a microwave & some cutlery, the one bedroom was also of an average size with only a sliding door separating the bedroom from the lounge/kitchen not providing much separation of noise etc. We were on the 38/f so had good views but overall giving up the extra services of a hotel I would expect more square feet & more in room facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed before, won't give them another chance.”
Reviews.Author: Risky_Rat
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Fraser Suites about five times over the past year, in between trying other hotels in Sydney, and now realise I am not willing to give them another chance. For some reason, I have been forgiving of this place in the past, probably because it was new and I was willing to left stuff go. But this time, the service, the cost of breakfast, and the tiredness of the rooms became the straws that broke the camel's back. Simply put, it's time to try other hotels, because this one doesn't offer much more than many others. It is certainly not five-star... definitely not my interpretation of five-star, which would include staff who are willing to go out of their way to help guests who are staying in the most expensive apartments. I stayed in a Premier Apartment, which I was told was the best quality apartment, but was very dissapointed. Looking out on to air conditioning units is not a five-star experience. Air-conditioners that switch on, and then rattle the building, are not five-star experiences. Waiting for two hours to get toilet paper is not a five-star experience. It wasn't great, and I have given this place a lot of chances, and now am finally willing to move on. They just didn't give me the impression that they wanted me to stay there, and I think a five-star hotel/apartment should be so happy to have you stay there, that you constantly feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Very overpriced and very small”
Reviews.Author: RossCobbinOZ
Reviews.Content: Hotel promises much, and charges much, but delivers very little. Swanky loobies and toiletries are all very nice, but if your room is so small that two of you can't walk in it at the same time something is wrong. Especially when the place proudly calls itself 'suites'. Our room was one of the smallest hotel rooms I have ever stayed in. It was described as a studio suite, but was basically a very small bedroom with a sink in it! The bathroom was nicely tiled, but had no bath. The breakfast was included in our rate and was pleasant but limited in choice. Staff were very helpful. But I always judge a hotel on the actual room they provide , and there are many more hotels in Sydney that offer a much better standard of room than this overpriced bedsit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Highbank-Condo
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely modern place in a superb locaton. The rooms are small and compact but especially well designed as they are both pleasing to the eye and functional. The only downside is that we hada great shower, but no bath which some tourists would prefer. Overall we had a really good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: saady
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only just over a year old - and it is beautiful. The service is outstanding, with a beautiful reception area to welcome you We stayed in a Studio Suite on the 40th floor with 180 degrees of Sydney from Darling Harbour to Woolloomooloo. The room was perfect, very modern with huge glass windows (that opened for fresh air) The gym is state of the art and the heated pool and spa were delightful. The breakfast was great - hot and cold selections on offer. It's only a short walk to main streets, including the Queen Victoria Building. All in all a great overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ebaty
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fraser Suites for 6 nights in December. We had interconnecting rooms for our family of 4. It was a great and relaxing way to stay. We had our own kitchen, washer, etc. The location is great. 5 minute walk to Darling Harbour, 2 minutes to great shopping and 5 minute taxi or 20 minute walk to the Sydney Opera House!! The staff is nice enough. Not very punctual but courteous as all Australians are. There are great places to eat breakfast around the area as well. I wouldn't recommend the one at Frasers. It wasn't included in the room charge and was over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Fraser Suites”
Reviews.Author: vilagirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fraser Suites last night and enjoyed it immensely.Did the Spring Special from Wotif which included breakfast and late checkout. (12.00pm) Parking was easy. ($30) Check-in was smooth and quick. Was allowed in room at 10.30 which was really handy. Studio Room was spotless. Small, but all we needed for a one night stay. Had a great view from the 25th floor. Swam in the 20m pool. Loved the see-through floor to the people on escalators below! Towels provided in the changerooms between the pool and the gym. Gym looked very well set out with lots of free weights and machines. Some traffic noise from the street below but I think it depends on which side of the hotel your room is on. It didn't keep us awake though. Great access from Level 10 to George Street via a walkthough arcade past some Japanese restaurants and cafes. 7/11 close by and very handy to King St wharf/Darling Harbour area. Breakfast was high quality food but small in quantity. Still ate a lot and didn't need lunch till late afternoon. No fried eggs but yummy bacon and scrambled eggs.Wouldn't pay for brekkie separately though. This is a very classy hotel. Lots of glass and mirrors. Very helpful and friendly staff. Highly recommended. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: artsyfarsty
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Fraser Suites. We stayed for two nights in a 1 bedroom deluxe suite overlooking the Darling Harbour area. The staff were friendly and accomodating. The location of the hotel is good. It is on a quiet street but close to food and entertainment. Our room was neat and tidy with a modern feel. Everything seemed new apart from some scuff marks on the wooden floor near the window. The kitchen was more compact than expected. The fridge is quite small and is mostly full of minibar items. It has a small compartment to keep things frozen. Even when the minibar items are put on the counter, the fridge is still very small for those who are staying more than one night and plan to cook their meals. We did appreciate that the cleaning staff cleaned the kitchen without an extra charge from the hotel. A cooked buffet breakfast was included with our stay. The buffet was small to medium sized though the food was good. The food attendants make espresso coffee on request. We will be visiting again!

Reviews.Title: “great view”
Reviews.Author: fanbelt
Reviews.Content: stayed here for wedding anniversary. everything nice and new. we found staff to be very accomadating and helpful. we requested early check in and it was no problem. we had breakfast while there wasnt huge range it was enough. im glad it was included in hotel deal cause i read on review some one paid 32 dollars definetly not worth that. can eat out side for lot less with better choices. found the bed fantastic it was latex mattress and very very comfy. would just go back for that. definetly would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully Built Fraser Suites”
Reviews.Author: kiwinick81
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Fraser Suites on a couple of occasions now and have really enjoyed both stays. The best thing about the hotel would have to be the wonderful spacious suites, I stayed in a one bedroom deluxe and it has everything you need for an extended stay - kitchen, washer, great work desk etc... The only thing I would say is that the bathroom is rather small in relation to the size of the room, and with only a shower and no bath. The design is very nice, warm and contemporary with hardwood floors, huge floor to ceiling windows and limestone bathrooms. Everything has been executed to a nice quality. There is also a nice pool and a decent sized gym with good equipment. My only one true reservation is that the housekeeping was slightly cursory, and with so many glossy luxurious surfaces dust, grime and fingerprints quickly become apparent - certainly not a disaster but also not really up to 4 or 5 star standard. While the street isn't the most salubrious, on the slightly run down Kent, it is fantastically convenient to the city. You can walk literally anywhere in the city center from there in no time, it is close to both the restaurants of China town and hundreds of other great eateries that Sydney has to offer. Also right near both Town Hall train station and the monorail stop. All in all the location cannot be faulted. All up this is a super new hotel, the rooms are light, large and very comfortable - both of the ones I have stayed in have been on high floors with really pretty views out across Darling Harbour. Its not a true 5 star experience, but when you see what you're getting compared to other hotels in Sydney it represents fantastic value for money. Shop around online and you can find good deals.

Reviews.Title: “Service lacks attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: CottGal
Reviews.Content: Great location, beautiful setting. Great shower & bath facilities. Disappointing service for the price paid. Lacks attention to detail. A few examples. Bedside lamps x 2 did not work. Bedroom TV did not work. Iron made marks on my dress when I tried to use it. Wardrobe lacked lighting so going through clothes was mainly in the dark. Tried to get staff's help but receive lacklustre responses. Cutlery were not very clean, obviously not checked upon after previous visitors' departure. On a few occasions we gave way to staff with cleaning equipment in the lifts. Do they not have/use service lifts?

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Currimundi
Reviews.Content: We booked a mystery hotel package though WOTIF and were given this hotel. We booked a single deluxe room to attend a conference at Darling Harbour for the June long weekend. The reception was efficient and as requested they allowed us an early check in to change for a matinee show we were attending. The front office staff member Belinda went beyond what I expected as great hospitality when my wife asked if the room we had booked had a bath. Belinda showed us our booked room and another room on the 37th floor which had a bath. We were upgraded to this second room and the view was exceptional to encompass the harbour to north head and also around to include some of Darling Harbour. We stayed for two nights and the staff were always friendly and hotel was above all clean and well appointed. Comfortable beds good kitchen and furnishings. Easy access to Sydney CBD and also to Darling Harbour, great restaurants nearby as well. Contrary to some of the other reports our stay was above our expectations and we shall be returning to this place for next years conference.

Reviews.Title: “Great bang for buck”
Reviews.Author: snsf
Reviews.Content: I took a punt on Fraser Suites, booking a one-bedroom suite in the hotel's opening week. I've stayed in a couple of brand new hotels, and the experience can be topsy-turvy: not everything or everyone does what they are meant to! No such luck here - the room was twice as big as any other one-bedroom suite I've taken - plenty of room for work and play. The two plasma screens are probably a bit excessive but handy for a long stay. There was also a full set of crockery and cutlery (an included microwave would complete the kitchen). I found the staff to be friendly and efficient, but only dealt with them at breakfast and at check in/out.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly there...”
Reviews.Author: pmanve
Reviews.Content: We visited Fraser Suites in September 2007. After reading previous reviews i have to say we didn't experience any of the poor service described. We arrived early and the staff were very obliging in organising parking for the car and for our bags to be sent up to our room. Check in was efficient and the service was friendly. We have 2 young children (both under 2) so we had booked a deluxe 2 bedroom. Problem #1 - the 2 bedroom apartment is actually a 1 bedroom and a studio interconnected by a hallway. The doors are quite heavy, and there was no door stops to hold the doors open to make it one big apartment. We contacted the concierge 3 times before he finally brought a door stop up to us - however we could only have 1 - as the other one was needed elsewhere!! Ingeniously we managed to tie the doors open using the cords from the robes, however other than when our 18 month old slept in the bed we didn't use the studio side at all so it was really a waste of $200 in getting the 2 bedroom. The hotels location is great if you are doing things up that end of town. Very handy to the Entertainment centre, Capitol Theatre, Pitt Street mall, QVB and Darling Harbour - but for 1st time visitors and tourists there are hotels with better views and facilities elsewhere (Quay Grand at circular Quay is Fantastic.) Although the hotel is in the Spanish Quarter NONE of the nearby restaurants do takeaway - and as we have 2 young children we don't like dragging them out to restaurants at night - the hotel does not have room service - HOT TIP - ask reception for cuisine Courier/Mr Delivery menus and they will even charge it to your account. There was no bath in the bathrooms which may also be harder for some people with children - i do belive that the 1 bedroom premier suites do have baths though. I have to say thought that the bed is amazing - probably one of the best i have ever slept in - the showers are good - not annoying water saving ones - and teh kitchen facilities are good. All in all this is a pretty good hotel - and would be great for travellers with older children.

Reviews.Title: “A Stylish Abode”
Reviews.Author: telce
Reviews.Content: Well I chose to stay in this serviced apartment after knowing that the building and its interior is designed by architectural firm Foster & Partners. Upon arrival, I was impressed by its design and finishings which exudes simplicity and elegance, undoubtedly a creation of a renowned architect. The room(we had the studio) is also designed in the modern contemporary feel with quality finishings all around. Size of the room is a bit small, but the design was quite brilliant in saving space as many stuff are hidden in wall cabinets. Bathroom is clean, well maintained and bright. Toiletries supplied are that of Bolton Brown of London, expensive range! Apart from the above, it's location on Kent St is excellent, within walking distance to china town, Town Hall, QVB etc. If you know of the world famous restaurant Tetsuya, it's just across the road. Service is just satisfactory, it lacks the warmth and friedliness of asian hospitality. Now, what I dont like are:- - matteress is too soft, those wth backache will have a problem - the quilt is too thick and gets too warm during the night, after complaining they place a lighter quilt for me, but they couldnt even bother to put that in a quilt cover, so I didnt use it. - the ambience of the hotel is quite cold, perhpas due to lack of guests or lobby is far too small to have crowds gathered. - breakfast is exactly the same stuff everyday, so u will certainly get bored after a while Overall, at aroond AUD200/night with BF, I would certainly prefer this servied apartment to any mainstream hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Roler coaster of service”
Reviews.Author: Dansteveson
Reviews.Content: When I checked in the building was wonderful, very elegant. There were a few issues when I entered the lobby. I came at midday, the check in time was apparently 2 but I came a little early and was snapped at by a small blonde. I was happy to wait but a bit thrown off by the cold welcome. At 2 my room was ready and another receptionist gave me the key in a cute little pouch thing saying it would probably be done by the time I got there?. When I did get there, 4 people were in my room and one of them was in a different colour shirt. They were all sorta suprised to see me. The first one appologised and said she had not released yet but I was welcome to come in it would only be a few minutes with so many people in the room. They were very friendly and appologetic. When they finished the first one asked if there was anything else I needed and showed me how to use the phone to dial reception and housekeeping. The next day in the morning I needed more shampoo because I ran out and my girl friend needed to shower. I called reception and they said they would send. I waited 45 minutes and then I called again and they transfered me to housekeeping. I asked where my shampoo was and they said they had not recieved any request but would send in the next 5 minutes. Not even two minutes later an indian looking guy came to the door holding shampoo, conditioner, bath gel and body lotion and gave them all to me. Later in the day my girlfriend went out and I stayed to use my laptop. A room cleaner came and was very polite and shy but was happy to clean my room while I was in it. I heard someone talking to her outside and it was one of the ones in a yellow shirt. When she notice I was in the room she was very welcoming and asked me if I had recieved the shampoo to make sure. She left, then the cleaner finished but when I went in the bathroom she hadnt changed the towels. I called housekeeping and a lady explained that if they are hanging up they dont change but she would send someone. I stayed another day. Overall housekeeping was very quirky but friendly and prompt, front office varied from staff member to staff member, was very sluggish and often looked confused when asked questions. I think the most helpful people were a really tall guy at the desk called Craig? and a room cleaner in a yellow shirt called Laura or something. I did notice that some of the room attendants english wasnt so good but they were quick to bring someone who could understand what I was saying. I did really enjoy the hotel though it was very nice, and the views were great.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended...Read Why”
Reviews.Author: DontGo4_2ndBest
Reviews.Content: We booked on wotif.com. We chose the Winter Warmer package at approx $AU200/night. This included breakfast for two, a room obviously, use of pool, spa etc, champagne on arrival (cheap Australian one), late check out of midday. I'd read negative reviews on here and was pleasantly surprised to find we did not experience any of this. The stay was great, superior finishes everywhere, new hotel only 6 months old. The champagne was delivered without a reminder. Had to remind them about the paper in the morning though. Breakfast was yummy and plentiful. The pool is cute and the spa spacious, but a little tepid for my liking. Sauna and gym there too. Didn't quite make it to the gym though! There are no views in room but the location is very central to shopping dining etc. Directly across the road from Tetsuya's world class Japanese restaurant. But good luck gettting in on a whim. There are lots of nice hotels out there and what can make the difference is the manner of the staff. I found the staff to be pleasant enough but not quite attentive enough. You know when checking in I expect the staff to give you their undivided attention rather than chatting to other staff members. Also, on check out something like "Thanks for staying with us. Hope you enjoyed it." Not, 'ok that's fine".

Reviews.Title: “Just fabulous”
Reviews.Author: SallyNSW
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful weekend stay at Fraser Suites - great location, beautifully furnished suite (the lobby is very swish) and the front desk staff in particular went out of their way to make us feel very welcome from the moment we arrived. Would strongly recommend if you're tired of typical hotels and looking for something different.

Reviews.Title: “Good looking, but terrible service”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Was really looking forward to staying at new hotel in good location. After booking on line and then phoning to make sure room had two beds, arrived back to check in (3 times) found that there was no prioriety for this service and that even still, at much insistence, the beds were not separated. It took a no. of hours to rectify this mistake. The set-up of room was nice, but nothing in the fridge, no milk, no water, nothing. Unusual. Also, rooms were not made up the next day, despite someone knocking on our door at 8am to see if we needed more towels. When asked about this, there was no real response, but later admission that understaffed. Seems reception staff were completely overloaded and stressed. Later my friend wanted to get something to eat in the area or some takeaway advice as pouring with rain and she didn't know area. Could not be helped and did not receive any of pamphlets for takeaway as requested. Generally no request could be dealt with efficiently without feeling it was a stress on the staff. Also the entire stay the corridors were peppered with vacumn cleaners and blue laundry baskets. Also no in-house movies. Just generally a real lack of service for the price and placement of the hotel. Would be very hard pushed to return.

Reviews.Title: “There are better places out there”
Reviews.Author: JRrrr
Reviews.Content: First of all, I have never been charged for a newspaper in the morning before. Fraser really surprised me with this charge. When I checked in, they ased me to fill out a form, in that form it asked which newspaper I would like to receive in the morning. I checked one newspaper, and when I checked out, there was a charge for each newspaper I received. At other hotels, they would always give papers at no cost. So be sure to be ready to pay for the newspapers if you stay here...otherwise, don't choose to receive one. Customer service is not up to standard with the rest of the industry. There was no gesture whatsoever that say "thank you for staying with us" from check in to check out. I was disappointed. The room itself is quite modern, I stayed in the studio suite, but let me tell you, it was smaller than the place I stayed in NYC. It was actually one of the smallest hotel room I have always been in. Even my typical local hotel in Tokyo was bigger than this room. I echo the other comments and would suggest that you avoid this place if you have other options.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms but unprofessional, dreadful service”
Reviews.Author: JASONPTODD
Reviews.Content: The rooms were of good quality and very modern, although the beds weren't comfortable. Also, the room smelt of cigarettes. The service was very poor. It took 4 hours for us to be checked in and we almost checked in to a room with guests in. There were many issues with the keys. Housekeeping left our rooms unlocked whilst we were out. We were given 20+ keys in total as the keys would deactivate and we would then have to queue at reception to get new ones. The staff were quite unapolagetic and joking around with other rather than trying to help. Overall I would not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just needs John Cleese”
Reviews.Author: secondtimelucky
Reviews.Content: This place has not improved with time! When we first arrived we were issued with our keys but could not find the room. Only when we returned to reception were we told that our room was behind a door with a different number, but that the door shouldn't be closed. We arranged for groceries to be delivered to us and it took them twenty minutes to locate us when the delivery driver arrived (despite the fact that we had pre-warned them of its arrival). The rooms are incredibly small and lacking basic amenities such as a toaster and a book detailing hotel information. The bathroom was filthy, so much so that I would not use it. We asked that it be cleaned and waited for an hour before going out and reminding reception as we went out. Of course, when we returned it still was not clean. Housekeeping did it whilst we were there. It was not cleaned on two other of our five day stays. The first day we let it go, but when we contacted housekeeping on the second day they asked what we wanted done!!! The rooms appear not to have been dusted since the hotel's opening, and some of the glasses in our room appeared to have toothpaste wash in them. The housekeeping staff speak limited English (although they are very pleasant). Our hallway was constantly littered with a dirty linen trolley and the cleaning closet door was often ajar. The staff are incompetent, generally lacking basic customer service skills such as greeting customers with "Good morning" rather than "Are you checking out?". One evening they were more concerned about what pizzas they were going to order than attending to guests needs, and on another occasion loudly discussed another guest and the fact that they thought she was on drugs. The promised complimentary paper was delivered erratically. We asked for a taxi to be called on one occasion and after a long wait were advised that we were probably better off hailing one from the street. Every time we went to the reception desk we were asked if we were checking out! No, we are not checking out, there is another problem!!! The elevators are extremely slow and the reception area is freezing cold. There is no internet access in the business facilities. On the positive (I have to try to find some!) the recreation area is excellent (although I would be concerned about cleanliness) and the location is very central (5 minute walk to Darling Harbour).

Reviews.Title: “lovely rooms, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: ukm2009freqtrav
Reviews.Content: the suites here are very good standard - exceptional quality bathrooms and beds - the hotel has only been open 7 weeks. if you are looking for 5 star service however they have a long way to go. ask for a suite above floor 38. the swimming pool and spa are indoors but good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Lacks ‘ambience’ - Give it a bit more time.”
Reviews.Author: Heather3000
Reviews.Content: The reception is pretty and service was very friendly. This place has only been open for a few weeks so there were a few things 'missing' from this place. We were taken to a room on the 15th floor in which they said if we didn’t like it we could be upgraded to a room on the 19th floor. The room on the 15th floor was terrible. It felt somewhat like a prison cell where everything (lounge/dining/bedroom suite) was cramped into what seemed like a tiny little box and the views were the back of the brick walls of the surrounding buildings (very unattractive and extremely claustrophobic). For the amount of money we paid, I would have asked for my money back. So we went for the room on the 19th floor in which the room was a lot more spacious, (not as pretty as the website pictures), everything was set out nicely and the view was of the other surrounding apartments (eg: looking out onto other balcony's unsightly rubbish) and a little bit of Darling Harbour). Missing: ‘ambience’, welcome/facilities book, rubbish bin liners, and complimentary newspaper. Found a dirty towel in the bathroom (bathroom was nice) and a few dirty marks on the bedroom wall. (not what I had expected from a place like this). Luckily housekeeping came around to see if everything was ok and they were extremely apologetic and replaced the towel and cleaned the wall. Breakfast was pleasant. Small eating area (I think this area might be ‘temporary’ until they find a bigger room perhaps??) . Gym area, pool, sauna and spa were great. Location? Excellent!!! Right in the heart of Sydney city. Everything was close-by, Darling Harbour, China town, George Street, QVB. Great place to stay if you’re staying in the Sydney CBD. After our day-trip we returned to our room to find the rubbish bins had bin liners in them and two complimentary chocolate biscuits were placed in the kitchen area. This place seemed like it was forced to become available before it was actually ‘ready’. Felt sorry for the staff as they seemed “short-staffed” most of the time. Overall this place was okay. I would rate it as a 4 star apartment. Give it time (say another 06 months) and maybe it will improve. “Nice” for a weekend away.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, spacious and well appointed”
Reviews.Author: Happycan
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from one night at the newly opened Fraser Suites Sydney. My family had two separate suites, one of which had a separate bedroom, and combined kitchen / dining / lounge area; the other was a simple bedroom with tea / coffee amenities similar to a hotel room. Both had ensuite bathrooms. Both suites were very nicely appointed in a business style, with dark wooden floors, dark walls and yellow highlights used in the kitchen area and in some of the furniture. The views from the room were alright, with glimpses of Darling Harbour from our side of the building, but not spectacular. The suite with kitchen was everything a small family could want, with cooktop, fridge, whisper-quiet dishwasher, microwave and dining table, large lounge area with a large flat panel TV and DVD player (with another TV in the bedroom). Good value if you are staying for more than one night, as prices compare to smaller high-end hotels and the rooms are just as well decorated and you get more room to move and the option of cooking a meal or two there. For those who don't just want to laze around or shop, the leisure centre on level 12 was well-equipped, with a lap pool (50m, I think), spa, sauna, and gym area; all brand new of course. Breakfast was marred by having to wait some 45 mins due to the crowds. I would recommend either going early on a Sunday morning (before 9 am) or go during the week if you can, otherwise risk not having the full buffet experience as the food ran a little low. On the other hand, the restaurant staff were very attentive to our needs when we arrived to make up for the delay. At any rate, there are plenty of other places to dine in the area if this is a concern, so don't let this put you off. Location is fantastic, on a street parallel to the main shopping thoroughfare in the Sydney CBD (George St), so a bit quieter than the main road, yet still in close proximity to cinemas, supermarkets, shopping, bars ... the QVB, World Square, Chinatown, Darling Harbour etc. The reception staff are very friendly, polite and helpful. We were never asked to wait as the desk was well staffed at all times. The staff also were very keen to hear feedback and improve the service and facilities, which was pleasant to see, and I suppose a result of the fact that the Suites are newly opened, but hopefully a trend that continues. Overall a really good experience with a lot of bang for you buck! Wish we could have stayed longer.

HotelInfo.Name: Fraser Suites Sydney
HotelInfo.Address: 488 Kent Street, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
